We then strolled long the south side of the Thames towards Embankment. We marvelled at some of the street entertainers. Ben stood next to man who was sitting on thin air!

Route

How's he sitting down?

We made it back to the car and drove to Banstead Woods to collect Katie. We were not too sure when she'd arrive. We waited a good couple of hours. She had got lost earlier in the day, so was one of the last groups back. She done ever so well, carrying more than most. She has a real determination. It sounded that she had barely eaten so quite concerned. She could chose whatever she wanted for dinner. Fish and Chips was on the menu. Well done Katie.

Katie finished DofE

title.value: Gunnersbury parkrun, The Clink, Bankside walk, Katie D of E

info.content: A huge write off - that car that we bought last summer. Having pursued the car firm through the small claims courts and won, we decided not to press on with the bailiffs option as there was so much paper work, more costs and after speaking with Dave Rayner little chance of getting our money back. It has been a huge headache and we've decided to cut our losses. Recently got the car MOT'ed at a cost of Â£250. Sold it for Â£2,800 and after all the other costs, we must be over Â£2500 down in total. Grrrr

We all slept well last night. We waited till 8:30 before breakfast was served. It was worth the wait as well. Â£65 for the 5 of us including a good breakfast. Great value. We set off after 10 having first fixed a puncture on Katie's bike.

We headed south towards Christ's Hospital, Southwater and West Grinstead still along the railway line which ceased being as a result of the Beeching Report in 1966. It was colder than yesterday and people's bottoms were sore! We made good progress and stopped at a supermarker in Henfield for lunch. Jessica was doing ever so well, much better than yesterday. She was happy as she stuffed the iPad in the rucksack, set some tunes up and pressed play.

Jessica pushing it up the hill

We finally reached the end of the Downs Link path at the mouth of the River Adur in Shoreham. Next we headed west along the coast towards our final destination Brighton. It was tough going against the wind. Jessica was now going super slow..... but she stuck at it. We went on the spit of land along Basic Road South. Not much traffic and some big industrial units shipping ballast, steel and wood by the looks of things. We got to the promenade at Portslade and travelled to Hove admiring the views. We saw the burnt out pier and the new tower hanging over Brighton. We eventually arrived at the Palace Pier in the mid afternoon pretty well spent and ready for our treat, McDonalds!

Finished the Downs Link part at Shoreham

Reached Brighton Pier

We meandered our way through the Lanes and up to the main street to get our Makkie D's. We then had a small climb to reach the railway station. Two Adult tickets and 3 children tickets were Â£115. However, 3 adults and 2 child tickets were Â£86! Got to love the web of train ticketing. The galling thing was, no one checked our ticket all the way home!

We had a small problem when we reached Shalford. There was engineering works all the way to North Camp. Therefore we had to negotiate our bikes onto the coach.... which fortunately Daddy did somehow. The railway employee said it was not allowed. To finish our trip we had the short ride from North Camp to home. In total we did 55km and 61km = 116km over the weekend. Well done Gay's. Route

This is year 2 of spending a long time on a bike ride as a family. This year we aimed to get to Brighton starting from home. All five bikes were prepared. Daddy, Ben and Jessica all had upgrades from last year, and we bought our own paniers this time.

The weather forecast was a little dodgy. Fortunately the rain didn't come, although it was pretty cold. We put Ben in charge of navigation. He had the phone with the map and route on it. Well we didn't have a great start, Mummy forgot her inhaler, so turned back, then Ben started leading us the wrong way. We hadn't even got out of Frimley Green!

We got to Ash Ranges and the red flags were up, so we had to detour around into Pirbright. After a couple of hours we hit Guildford and sought refuge in Starbucks with a much needed warm drink and treats. Then it seemed a constant uphill struggle all the way up to St Martha's Church where there was a wedding and lots of DoE children. We stopped for lunch here overlooking the countryside.

Church At Pirbright

At St Martha's

Then the toughest parts of the journey hit us. It was extremely muddy through the Surrey Hills down through Bramley. Despondency was rife through the ranks as well as wet, muddy feet. We literally ploughed on and eventually got past the worst of it as we got to the disused railway line at Bramley. Daddy took up the wrong path which led us to some technically challenging terrain.

Finally we got on to the disused train line for some considerable time. We went along some straight track all the way to Cranleigh where we stopped for refreshments, before pushing on to our half way point of Slinford where we rested for the night. The Red Lyon was situated in the middle of the picturesque village. We had a room with just 4 single beds, so Mummy and Jessica cuddled up together. We didn't find it hard to get to sleep once we had our Dominoes pizza.

Finished for the day at the back of the Red Lyon

Route

title.value: Downs Link 1: Biking Home to Slinford

info.content:
The Fars had hired the hall out the back of the Surrey Cricketers, Windlesham for a mini birthday party for Farmor who celebrated 70 years - well yesterday anyway.

The Rostocks and both Auntie Susan's in laws and Ma Ma and Pop Pop were also in attendance. We arrived an hour early to dress the room up to make it all nice for Farmor. We sat and drank and ate a very nice meal. Susan had bought a selfie polaroid photo thing, which we had fun with. We also had a game of skittles which Ben was obviously the most competitive about. He managed to put off Ma Ma on one of her attempts, but Ma Ma had the last laugh as she made Ben miss completely! Of course Ben wiggled his way out by reminding us of the aggregate score!

Ben was on DJ duty and Katie on photos. Farmor opened her presents and Farfar made a funny speech. I don't think it was intentionally funny! We all had a nice time.

Top Table

Farmor and Joan

Birthday girl with the Denmark birthday cake

The three of us

Muma and a Dadda

Farmor's school friend, Joan and her husband Gert came over to England to visit. We invited them over for some tea and cakes so we could catch up. It was very nice to see they were fit, healthy and the same as ever.

The Rostocks

The inauguration swim of the Frimley Flippers took place this morning at the Kingfisher, Mytchett. Mummy and Jessica went off at 8am in their wet suits for a swim. They said it was cold at first, but ok after that.

Meanwhile Daddy went off on a mountain bike ride into Ash Ranges and got a little lost. He refuses to turn back, so when the path got narrower and narrower he forged ahead dragging the bike through the swampy bits of the Ranges. We're convinced no one else has done that route on a bike before.

Ash Ranges

Route

Daddy did a BBQ Sunday lunch which was nice, especially as we sat outside in the sun. We then biked in the woods to the Mytchett Canal centre. We hired a pedalo and proceeded to be a menace on the water ways. Ben got grumpy and frustrated that he couldn't steer the vessel. Anyway it was fun. We had an ice cream after and went home to watch some more Prison Break.

Pedalo'ing

First up was parkrun and the Flyers were doing a pacing weekend. We had representatives from 20 to 40 mins and at some points we had two of us running. Daddy paced 27 minutes with Alfie. It was so nice to help people along.

Flyers Pacers

We had our penultimate fixture of the season at Heatherside. We had a full squad of all 15 players which was nice to see. We could get a squad lineup photo. We ran out winners by 5-1. Things are a little more calm this week. Ben had to leave at half time to go to his next event.

Mytchett Athletic Falcons U13s 2017/18. Top: Loz, Oli, Tom, Abe, Cam, Ben H, Jayden, Charlie, Daddy. Bottom: Callum, Kieran, Yuv, Freddie, Ethan, Alex, Dan, Ben G

The next event being quad biking down at the edge of the New Forest. Ben and Joey had an hour and a half of circling a track. The confidence grew and grew. Joey had a moment where he lost concentration and hit the barriers quite hard which shook him up for a bit. He continued on. Ben came off absolutely loving it. He was full of it. We like to see that.

Quad biking

Ben headed off to the Elders to stay the night. The rest of us went home and watched Die Hard. Too much swearing in it!

title.value: Parkrun Pacing, Football, Quad Biking, Ben Sleepover

info.content: Ben had an outstanding Parent's evening and interim school report, whilst Katie was rewarded the Titanium award for attaining lots of award points. Jessica achieved Star of the Week at school for being kind to her friends.
Mummy, Daddy, Ben and Jessica went to the rec to play cricket for 30 minutes in the evening. Very nice.

Daddy went off to Alton to meet with some friends to do a 40 miler. Route

In the afternoon Daddy and Ben went to Aldershot Banger racing along with the Elders and Ma Ma and Pop Pop. Daddy chatted with Gary there which was funny. The highlight was undoubtedly the American Styled DD at the end. All the cars were in a squared off part of the track. They faced each other and when the flag went down some just drove full speed into their opposite number. Mental.

Aldershot Krew in the rain

title.value: Alton Bike Ride and Aldershot Bangers

info.content: Parkrunned at Frimley as we had a match straight after against Yateley Pumas.

Daddy's glucose control isn't too good and he's taken it upon himself to improve his situation. To that end he's bought the Libre Freestyle sensors which is stuck in your arm and uses NFC comms with the phone to download the results. A pretty graph is drawn using the XDrip+ app. Time will tell if things improve.

Daddy did his usual DIY Passport photos

Passport

In the morning we went with the Turners over to the Crowthorne section of Swinley Forest for a MTB run. Ben having been ill recently didn't have much in the legs. It was nice to do some parts of Swinley not previously tackled before. It was pretty muddy out there. Route

Ben suffering in Swinley

In the afternoon we went over to Ma Ma and Pop Pops for a belated family Easter party. It was pretty manic with all the children there playing various party games.

Ma Ma's party

title.value: Swinley MTB, Ma Ma's Easter Family Party

info.content:
Ben not feeling too well and no football, Daddy saw this as an opportunity to do another tourist parkrun. It was at Hazelwood, where London Irish train.

We headed off to do walk 100 over in Pangbourne. We thought it was walk 99 at the time, so no big celebration! It was a wet, wet day. Daddy and Ben only wore trainers and subsequently ended up with wet feet as they walked along the Thames. Katie and Jess played in one of the streams. On our way home we popped in to Steven's for a catch-up and a cup of tea. When we got home Daddy and Ben were happy to watch the Manchester derby. Route

River Thames, Pangbourne

title.value: Hazelwood parkrun, Walk 100 - Pangbourne, Steve Tea

info.content: Daddy had a two day training course in posh offices in Paddington. It was on becoming a Certified Scrum Master. The course was very interesting. Daddy passed the exam so he is now certified!

Ben really wasn't feeling too good, so stayed at Ma Ma and Pop Pop's whilst the rest of us headed down to Lymington to catch the ferry over to the Island Of Wight as Jessica terms it. We were foot passengers and enjoyed the 45 minute journey across the murky Solent, playing Uno. Once arrived we caught the bus, where the driver was experiencing her first ever drive in her new job!

We reached base camp at the Needles. It was a series of shops and entertainments, like a mini holiday area. It was deserted, we guess due to the poor weather. We watched a 4D cinema film, then went on the scary chair lifts down the cliff to the water's edge. It was windy and rainy. Katie was pretty scared. The chairs do ascend/descend across a fairly steep gradient.

The chair ride down

We caught the tourist bus up to the Needles, but didn't explore around as the weather was appalling. We ended back at Yarmouth to grab lunch from the bakery. Skimmed stones on the mini beach before catching an early boat back to the main land again.

Needles in the background. Somewhere

Making sand bottles

Katie expressed a desire to go and see the shops owned by TOWIE stars (The Only Way Is Essex). We jumped at the chance, so headed around the M25 to Brentwood. We trawled the High Street and visited half a dozen shops and some of the hang out haunts used in the program. Katie was very self conscious of not looking sad when taking photos of her in front of these shops. One of the last we visited we actually went in and Katie bought some clothes.

Outside Chloes, Brentwood High Street

Daddy decided that he was going to bike home and so got on his road bike and headed off towards London. He passed the Olympic Stadium, Bank, London Wall and the Houses Of Parliament. It took him 6 hours to get home!

Route

London Wall

Olympic Swimming Centre

title.value: Brentwood Towie Shopping - Cycle Home Through London

info.content:
Jessica still not feeling too well today. However, after some medicine she lasts for a couple of hours in the land of living. We had a decorate your egg and handing over chocolate eggs to each other. Daddy didn't get mummy an egg this year, citing that there are too many in the house.

Eggselent Breakfast

Daddy stayed behind to garden and look after Jessica whilst the rest of us went to church. Ben confidently made a reading in front of the congregation. People remarked how well he did. That boy does not suffer from nerves.

We had Susan and Graham and the Fars over for Sunday lunch. Mummy had slow boiled beef in a gravy. It was very nice. Jessica and Ben made pudding which consisted of taking the top off an Easter egg and filling it with chocolate ice cream, raspberries, blueberries and cream. Not one for the health enthusiasts. Charlotte, Loz and Lenny later popped by as well.

Easter lunch

title.value: Ben church reading, Easter Sunday with Gay's

info.content:
Daddy on a bit of a mission of not repeating runs or bike ride routes at the moment. Therefore he decided to try a new parkrun, Osterley Park. Half of it was on proper paths the other half on grass and with all the rain it became a bit of a mud bath.

Route

After rushing home we all then went out to Reading town centre and met with the Sanders to go in the Compassion HGV lorry. There were separate rooms recreating the life of a Ugandan girl. Her home, school, hospital. It was there so you could potentially sponsor a child. It had little impact on the children I think, but we thought it important to go, to attempt to show how lucky the children should feel.

Outside The Compassion Centre

After a photo and a face painting we headed off to Pinkney's Green and a National Trust egg hunt. We got there just in time as we hadn't noticed the 2pm closing time. It was a little disappointing as there were no clues to solve and turned out to be a 1km circular walk around a field! We collected our eggs and swapped Easter goodies between the families.

Pinkney's Green Egg Hunt

Route

After we scooted to Camberley as we had to get our eyes tested. Jessica had her done at the hospital and they were fine. Both Ben and Katie didn't need glasses, although Katie really wanted them so she could look intelligent, so she says.

Mummy and Daddy both needed reading glasses. Mummy embarrassed us all with her selection. Katie almost ran out of the shop in distress! Daddy couldn't find a pair that he and mummy liked.

title.value: Osterley Park parkrun, Compassion Bus, Pinkney's Egg Hunt, Eye Test

info.content:
In the morning the Elders came over and joined us for the Easter workshop at St Andrews church. Ben ran the obstacle course game for the children. The children love him. There were arts, crafts and food making stalls. After there was a church service that even Daddy stayed for. The Elders popped back for a cuppa before parting ways. We went over to Sylvies for the annual egg hunt at her house.

Ben running the Children's obstacle course

After watching a couple of episodes of Prison Break Season 1, Daddy left us to motorbike to Reading. It was raining lots. Phil had a ticket for him which was most generous. It was a good game to watch with Reading 1-0 for most of it, despite going down to ten men and conceding a penalty in the 90th minute. The QPR fans weren't happy when it was saved. There were some coins being thrown between the fans.

title.value: Good Friday Workshop, Sylvie's Egg Hunt, Reading v QPR

info.content:
In the morning Ben went off to Thorpe Park with his friends: Oli, Kieran and Yuv. First of many this year it sounds. They went on all the big rides. They experienced the Derren Brown ghost train simulator ride for the first time.

Thorpe Parkers

Daddy meanwhile has got a thing for filling in his running and biking heatmaps. Today there was a large hole in the Wokingham area so headed without a plan to that area. He found it tough going. After lunch we watch some more Prison Break season 1 which we like at the moment.

Mummy and Jessica went to church, whilst Katie was still recovering from her DoE exploits. In the afternoon Daddy went off to New Malden to pickup Jessica's new bike and collect the boys.

title.value: Ben Thrope Park, Daddy Wokingham Ride, Katie Party

info.content:
Katie Gay spent last night out in a two man tent with Georgia somewhere in the Surrey Hills.She had to walk 9 miles with a massive rucksack on her back and today she walked 15 miles. The tent she had unfortunately was a beach tent apparently, so was not waterproof. Of course it rained, so poor old Katie only managed to get to sleep at 4am!

Today she walked from Puttenham down to Farley Green, then back up to Newlands Corner. They got lost a bit, so re-traced their steps to get on the right track. Out of the 5 who started in their group, only 3 finished!

Meanwhile Ben had a game, without Daddy being there, against Cove Leopards who they beat 8-1 two weeks ago. Unfortunately we lost 1-0 to a dodgy penalty. Cove had some players back and looked a different team. The spirits were good, although we are having difficulties with the players commitment and one of the parents who thinks they know best.

Daddy was equally active in the morning. He motorbiked down to Salisbury and did their 4 lap parkrun. It was OK, not his favourite circuit. He then continued down to join the other Frimley Flyers for their Rio arranged brewery tour. Rio are owned by Hall and Woodhouse who brew Badger beer in Blandford Forum. So he spent a couple of hours on the tour as well as sampling a couple of the beers.

Hall and Woodhouse Flyers

After picking up Katie in the afternoon we had a nice treat Fish and Chip dinner and collapsed in front of the TV. Katie was asleep by 8:30pm!

title.value: Duke Of Edinburgh, Football, Salisbury parkrun, Hall and Woodhouse Brewery tour

info.content: We went to see Jessica's teacher for parents' evening. She had been doing badly in Maths and English.... Here results were below 10% in tests. The teacher did not understand why this should be so in Maths. She had been doing well. Jessica said she felt under time pressure in the tests. In English she is not great at spelling... and for the last test she hadn't realized there was more than one page of questions! Anyway we have arranged Jessica to have some tutoring with Ma Ma, once a week starting in the Easter holidays to try and get her back up to the mainstream. We are not too worried (worried nonetheless) as we don't think she's as bad as the results say.

It was supposed to be a packed day today. However, because of the snow, the Fleet Half Marathon which Daddy was supposed to run and our afternoon over in Gillingham with Helen and Fiona had been cancelled. This meant we had a lazy day at home doing odd jobs, church and a marathon game of Trivial Pursuit which Ben eventually won. We all were within one cheese of winning.

In the evening Daddy went with Jessica and Ben onto the hill at the rec. They were the only ones there to go sledging. Brilliant.

We started the day with snow threatening us. It was bitterly cold outside. Daddy started off with a trip to Frimley Lodge and parkrun. He took it particularly easy because of the impending Fleet Half marathon the day after..... which in fact later got called off!

parkrun

The Falcons had an important game against Liss Cobras Blue. The losers were pretty certain not to get the remaining promotion spot.... and unfortunately we lost 5-2. It was possibly the coldest game ever, with snow being brushed off so we could see the lines. We had 4 subs as well which meant we had to rotate constantly otherwise they would have frozen to the ground! A mixture of weather, lack of effort and poor attitude probably led us to defeat having been in the lead at 2-1.

Falcons in the snow

In the afternoon Daddy and Ben headed off to Cobham services. Daddy had bought a Bike Box from a person living in Ashford. He had hoped it was Ashford, Middlesex. But no it was of course Ashford, Kent! Luckily the man was travelling to Wimbledon which was lucky as we were going that way too. The chap even reduced the price of the bike box to Â£80. Bargain. Once collected the boys headed up to the Imperial War Museum as Ben had been pretty enthusiastic about wars (is that a good thing?). They parked around the corner at about 4:15pm so had just under 2 hours to explore the place.

They started at the bottom of the museum intending to make their way up. Ben was so interested they spent most of the time in the World War I section. It was very well laid out. The exhibits were interesting. Ben tried to justify his hours spent on the PlayStation by identifying all the guns. Again a bit of a worry. The boys vowed to return back in the summer after a London parkrun.

Imperial War Museum

After, they headed down the cosmopolitan Walworth Road and a KFC beckoned. Ben's choice. And it was greasy. A bargain bucket with 6 chicken pieces. Daddy was almost sick after that. Ben couldn't munch his way through all that!

About to enter the Academy a la Brixton

Next stop was Brixton. They parked 5 minutes away from the O2 Academy and met with the Harvey's in the seating at the top. It was Ben's first proper gig. He thought it was very loud but was rocking away, especially to Buck Rogers! The boys had a great day.

It finished at 11pm. There was driving snow. They gave the Harvey's a lift home. Didn't get home until quatre to one.

title.value: parkrun, Ben Football, Imperial War Museum, Feeder Gig, Lily sleepover

info.content:
After watching Evie's show last weekend, Jessica has become very enthusiastic to join in a play or production. So we joined her up with the group that Katie was with last year, and Katie's friend Catherine is still a member of.

Jessica came back after the two hour session having loved it. They played a mixture of games and she was introduced to the script, Romeo and Julliet. Jessica wondered who was going to play the role of the frog..... thinking it was Gnomeo and Julliet! She hadn't realized the Shakespearean aspect to the piece! She landed the role of one of the Capulet (Juliet's) family.

Mummy and Jessica went around to Ma Ma and Pop Pops to give Ma Ma her Mother's Day present. They snuck into the house and secretly made breakfast in bed for Ma Ma. Jessica pretended to be a burglar and shocked poor Ma Ma.

Daddy went to see Farmor. Mummy had presents from Jessica and Ben, but Katie lost her bank card so couldn't get anything!

Later in the afternoon we all went around to the Fars where we played games for an hour or so, before Katie and Ben went to Church Club.

Ben's card

Jessica's card

A busy morning. First Katie went along with Georgia to school as a prep meeting for her Duke Of Edinburgh bronze, hike and camp weekend. She took in her rucksack fully packed with tent, sleeping bag, the works. We bought her new boots, leggings, plate, tent, etc. for it.

Meanwhile the rest of us went to Cove Football Club to watch Ben play against Theo's team. Unfortunately Theo was not well, but the team played well and won the game 9-1! Ben had an average game.

We all met up for lunch back at home, then we headed towards Fareham, and Fort Nelson. We weren't sure what to quite expect. However, it was a grand fort with a museum and a chance to look at some guns, cannons, tunnels, and the fort itself. We must have been a couple of hours exploring around. Of course, Daddy and Ben paid more attention to the exhibits than the girls. We stopped off at Port Solent for a spot of Fish and Chips overlooking Porchester Castle on the way home.

Down in the tunnels in Fort Nelson

Eating Fish and Chips in Port Solent

In the evening Evie and Richard were performing in a show over in the Princes Theatre, Aldershot, so the girls went over to watch. the boys stayed in and watched 4 episodes of World War 2 In Colour!

title.value: 9-1 Football, Katie DoE prep, Fort Nelson, Evie show

info.content:
Daddy decided to run home from work today. Farfar gave him a lift in to work. There were many well wishers, especially with the weather being dark and dismal. Daddy didn't mind this. People at work were so sweet asking for a text when he got in, and to check his sugar levels. Sugar levels were at 14, so he took 4m/mols, to take the edge off. However, this was probably his downfall. After scaling the Hogs Back at Puttenham, Daddy began to feel a bit weary. Eventually after crossing the Ranges he called up mummy to collect him as he was struggling too much. His levels had dropped to 2.3! A challenge to re-try one feels.

Route

Jessica went in as Alice in Wonderland

Jessica in Wonderland

Daddy motorbiked up to London to visit the Museum of London which was very interesting. Interested to see the Romans building it up, then it went into nothing because the Romans left in 400ad. Then the like of the plague killed the population growth, and the boundaries were set for a long time - the London Wall. It wasn't until after the Great Fire London things accelerated again. It was quite interesting for Daddy.

Museum of London

Meanwhile the rest of us went over to Ma Ma and Pop Pop's.

title.value: Museum of London, Ma Ma and Pop Pops

info.content:
Ben slept over at Jonny's last night so we didn't see him in the morning.

The other 4 of us split in two. Daddy and Jessica went to do parkrun in the snow. Daddy pulled Jessica around the whole 3 mile course! Jessica enjoyed it!

Only 400 metres done

Canal turn

Flyers Lineup

Meanwhile Daddy gave Mummy a tri down the hairdressers.... and Mummy treated Katie to a trip as well. So they went to Grayderz in Frimley Green to have their hair chopped and eyebrows done.

At lunchtime Mummy and Daddy went for their annual Marie Curie collecting stint, this time at the Meadows.

Marie Curie collection

title.value: parkrun Sledge, girls hairdressers, Marie Curie collecting,

info.content:
It's been snowing on and off for the past 2 days. Today was the full day at home for us children as the schools were shut. Mummy and Daddy worked from home. We managed a number of trips up to the rec. There were loads of people there.

Jessie!

Jessica racing down Frimley Green rec

It was exceptionally cold all day. Daddy went for another training run, trailing the streets of Camberley attempting new roads so it'll look more diverse on a heat running map. Don't ask! Route

In the afternoon Ben went off to the cinema with Callum to watch Black Panther. The film got a thumbs up from him.

Daddy painted in the kitchen to freshen up some of the walls and did other DIY jobs. Mummy went to church and in the evening Ben and Katie went to a church session much to their dissatisfaction.

Painter

title.value: Long Run, Ben Cinema Black Panther

info.content:
Football was going to be at Frimley Lodge Park. However, Daddy was the one to decide whether it should be played or not. It was a tough decision and one that was made as he was on his second lap of parkrun!

This left a free spot in the afternoon. Just right for another walk. A longer one this time. 4.5 miles on Reigate Hill. We got lost a bit in the first mile and walked on some private farmers land and eventually crossed a foot bridge to a disused farm! Very spooky. Us children didn't moan as much as usual. We were primed early enough. Anyway we completed the muddy walk in a couple of hours and came home to some sweet treats from the shops and a nice mug of hot chocolate. Route

Reigate Hill temple

Reigate Hill walkers

In the evening Mummy and Daddy went out to Dave Peddle's 50th Birthday party held at Camberley Cricket Club. It was a fun evening as first there was some food, then a music quiz, which we clubbed together with Lee and the Erskines. After that there was a Russian Trio who entertained us with songs. Great fun. The Fars came to babysit us.

Party go-ers

title.value: parkrun, Walk 99 Reigate Hill, Dave Peddle 50th Party

info.content: Ben's starting to get really good friends with Johnny now. No.1 Friend? Ben, Johnny, Katie and Catherine went out to Camberley in the evening first to eat ice cream at Creams, then into the arcade to play some video games. All four returned for a sleepover at our house.

title.value: Ben and Katie Creams and Arcades with Catherine and Johnny + Sleepover

info.content:
In the morning Daddy and Ben went out mountain biking with Oli and Jon in the Tunnel Hill area. Route

Ben deep in a puddle

Mummy went to church, the rest of us lazy children stayed at home, objecting to keep Mummy company.

After a lovely Sunday lunch we headed off for a walk. Within a mile there was a problem with the brakes on the car, so we had to turn around and go back home. We flaked out in the afternoon and evening with a mix of card games, computer games and watching Winter Olympics.

We had an earlier than usual kick-off over on Ancells Park, Fleet. We were against Hart Tornados. They only had 10 men so we felt obliged to also only play with 10. We won the game 10-4.

After lunch we went over to Gravity Force to bounce up and down for an hour. After Daddy swapped his Valentines present for a couple of work shirts. We left him at the Meadows Roundabout as he wanted to run 11 miles home! Route

In the evening Mummy and Katie went to Prezzo in Camberley for a nice meal.

Pre School friends, Natasha, Nina and Grace

title.value: Falcons Football, 11 mile run, Gravity Force, Meal with Katie Preschool friends

info.content:
Daddy got mummy a haircut and a nice top, whilst mummy got daddy some trousers which were later swapped for a couple of smart work shirts from Next. They went to the Wheatsheaf in the evening for a meal.

Lovers

Daddy's card to mummy

In the morning Mummy ran Sunday school, whilst Daddy went out for a slow 10 mile run taking in Ash Ranges. Route

After Sunday lunch we went out for walk 98. Tidmarsh, outside Reading was the destination. A nice wildlife walk spoiled slightly by the roar of the M4! We started in the sunshine and Daddy even contemplated not taking a coat. Half way round we were hit by a couple of hail storms. It made things interesting!

Route

Monkies

Before hail storm

Football was again cancelled this week as the opposition could not field a team. Auntie Ellie and Mummy went off early to help Ma Ma and Pop Pop again at their car boot fair, whilst Daddy ran parkrun.

Later in the afternoon we picked up Ameret and Yuv and took them to Coral Reef. Steve and Matt had hired out the pool for an hour as a Christmas present. So there were 40 or 50 of us who had the pool and flumes all to ourselves. No one had been since they had done the place up. Other than the flumes it was difficult to see what they had done! The flumes were excellent. 3 requiring inflatable tyres and two quicker slides. We all had a great time.

Spa Pool

Volcano

Karen had arranged a birthday get together at a bar in Fleet which Mummy and Auntie Ellie were invited too. Lily came for a sleepover. Ellie was determined to cross off her getting drunk and go clubbing tick boxes as part of her to do list for turning 40. They had 6 cocktails.

Party girls

title.value: Mummy and Ellie going out out. Lily sleepover

info.content:
Daddy went out early door for a 40 mile bike ride with the Rockets.

Route

Rockets Riders

In the afternoon we all went down to the Harvester for lunch with the Home Bible group that Mummy sees each Wednesday.

At 6am we were awoken by Ma Ma and Pop Pop who were going to take Jessica and Katie to the car boot fair. They had a car boot-full of gear to sell. However, the girls were not very compliant. In the end mummy popped down to help out.

We had varied family support in the big match, Mytchett Falcons v Alton Huskies. It was a one sided affair to be honest. Joey playing in defence put in some solid tackles, whilst Ben in midfield played some nice passes. It ended with a home victory, 5-0. The Elders returned for some lunch before heading off in the afternoon to the Trampoline park in Basingstoke for Joey's 13th birthday party. They had an hours worth of fun before we all headed off to McD's for some nurishment! We parted ways with the Elders. Ben went to Alton for a sleepover, whilst Lily came home with us and played with Katie and Jessa. Ma Ma and Pop Pop also stayed the night.

Pre Bounce Shot

title.value: parkrun, boot fair, Falcons v Huskies, Joey 13th party, Sleepovers

info.content:
Jessica still not feeling too well so we didn't do too much more than play more Uno.

In the later afternoon, the Fars treated us to a couple of hours down the bowling alley. Daddy scored one of his best scores ever with 129. We of course had the guide rails up. It was good fun.

Uno

Ten Pin Bowling at Farnborough

Daddy parkrunned in the morning. The Falcons game was called off. It is very wet out there. Jessica was off school yesterday and wasn't feeling 100% today so we played some Uno.

In the evening Katie and Ben went on a sleepover to the same house (weird). Their friends Jonny and Catherine are siblings. They stayed up late and ate pizza.

title.value: parkrun, Falcons, Jonny and Catherine sleepover

info.content:
We got a message rom Eagle Radio to see if we wanted to par-take again the Family Faceoff game. Of course Mummy said yes. Jessica was her intended opponent, however Ben wanted to take a 2-0 lead. Here is a link to the video of the radio program!

Eagle Radio studio when we were on

Daddy and Ben woke to snow. As part of the Frimley Flyers league, Ben was running the Farnborough 5km with Daddy. As mummy was in Kent, the boys had to bike to the start by the airport. It was very cold. The boys arrived slightly late and missed the start. Fortunately times were recorded from a chip, so it didn't really matter too much. It did mean they started at the very back. They first overtook Dennis and ended up finishing in the top 10%! 25 minutes was the time, earning Ben maximum points in the league.

Ben crossing the finishing line

On the cold cycle home the boys were talking about having a nice warm bath, a hot chocolate, having the fire going and snuggling up. Bliss.

The rest of the day was spent not doing a lot!

Daddy went to parkrun in the morning and ran with Dave Peddle to get a time under 25 minutes which he was happy with.

Ben's football match was soon after at Heatherside. Badshot Lea were the opponents and it was a real knife-edge match. It could have gone either way. In the end it was 2-2 in the wet and muddy conditions.

We then rushed off to Ma Ma and Pop Pops as we were due to go around the cyclo park. However, the poor weather put pay to that, so we played board games instead.

Jessica stayed for a sleepover in Istead Rise, whilst we took Summer back home to stay the night. Unfortunately at about 4am in the morning Mummy and Katie took her back to Gravesend as she was not feeling too well.

Scoffing away

title.value: parkrun, football, Istead Rise, Jessica and Summer sleepovers

info.content:
We all weighed ourselves and recorded our heights:

  • Daddy Pig: Height: 175.5cm Weight: 79.2kg
  • Mummy Pig: Height: 165cm Weight: 66.3kg
  • Katie Pig: Height: 162.5cm Weight: 48.5kg
  • Benny Pig: Height: 144cm Weight: 33.8kg
  • Jessica Pig: Height: 133cm Weight: 33.8kg

Believe it or not, it was Daddy pig who had the worst BMI!

In the morning Daddy, Jessica and Ben joined the whole Stroud family, plus Barrie, Emma and Kieran came. They went up into the woods behind St Catherines Road. Jessica wanted mud and puddles. Unfortunately this was her undoing. She ended up in a deep puddle, got wet and cold very quickly and returned home. Fortunately Ben was looked after by the others so could do the jumps.

Ben at the jumps

In the afternoon we took another leaf out of the Berkshire walk book. This time near Maidenhead and a 2 miler in Braywick Nature Reserve. Katie was very concerned that we would not make it back in time for her meal out with her friends which spoiled it for her a bit. We saw some archery, ran around the running track and visited 2 playgrounds en-route.

Katie went out to Camberley for a meal at Nandos. There was a bit of trouble when there was a disagreement and a couple of the guests walked out! Katie and her friend Catherine had a nice time though.

title.value: MTBing, Walk 97 - Braywick Nature Reserve, Katie party meal in Camberley

info.content:
Daddy had to miss parkrun because football had a 9:30 kickoff time. The Falcons were away to Yateley Pumas u13s. Ben played mostly in central midfield and managed to score a goal. He should have headed in a second, but we were all pleased for Ben. The Falcons won 5-0.

In the afternoon, The Elders, Ma Ma and Pop Pop joined us for the chutch new years party which Mummy helped run with a few games. It was the usual mix of food and quizes.

Prize time

Lily stayed with us for a sleepover. She played with Jessica and Katie and watched films late on.

title.value: Ben scores, New Years Church Party, Lily sleepover

info.content:
Ben and Daddy got up early to bike to Wales and back again! It was icey, so we had to be careful. The route took them down some lovely country roads. the people were very friendly. The border was defined by the River Severn. They made it the 9 miles to a bridge by Crewegreen, stepped into Wales and returned back to base.

Route

Literally on the border between England and Wales

In the afternoon the children stayed in, Mummy and Pop Pop went into the shops in Shrewsbury, whilst the others went for a walk across some fields with the dogs. Daddy went on the bike and extended the trip out.

In the afternoon we were back in the pool for an hour or so.

Jump shot!

title.value: Bascurch Weekend - Bike to Wales, More pool action

info.content:
In the morning daddy ran parkrun on his own in Shrewsbury. He ran his best time for over a year, so he was very pleased.

Route

In the late morning we split into two groups. One lot when to Shrewsbury Prison for an escape room experience. It involved dressing up as inmates and starting the game handcuffed and a bag tied over our heads! The girls team managed to get out within the hours, solving the riddles. The boys however did not fair so well.

Prisoners

The second group were supposed to enter the grounds of Shrewsbury Castle, however, it was shut! Instead we looked around the shops of Shrewsbury to get Ma Ma a swimming costume. It was very cold.

Daddy and Jessa at Shrewsbury Castle

We reconvened back at the house for lunch. We were allowed the swimming pool complex from 2pm for 5 hours....... we spent all 5 hours in the pool and made the most of it. Daddy started a tournament up. First were swimming races, then a pool tournament. There was a hot tub, gym equipment, a sauna, plenty of pool toys and a dart board. It certainly kept us entertained.

title.value: Bascurch Weekend - Escape Prison, parkrun, Shrewsbury, Pool

info.content:
Double parkrun. First at Rushmoor, then a muddy Frimley Lodge. Dave was doing his 250th and Alex his 100th parkrun.

Frimley Flyers

In the afternoon we went out for a long walk around a Loddon Nature reserve near Twyford. It was very muddy and we got a bit lost.

Route

Kit Kat

Muddy Walkers

title.value: Walk 96 - Loddon Nature Reserve, Double parkrun

info.content:
In the morning Daddy and Ben went out on the bikes with Kieran and Barrie.

Deepcut Jumps

The weather wasn't great so we postponed our walk, instead playing a nice game of Risk. Mummy won. Her mission was to wipe out Katie.

Risky business

We went over to the Elders in the evening where we played Codenames, played computer games and had a yummy roast pork. We saw New Year in on the big cinema screen.

The Krew
Peter Pan

We awoke in Istead Rise. Daddy thought he'd best go on a run to appreciate the local countryside before Ma Ma and Pop Pop move house. He did a 5 mile circular which took in some lovely oast houses and a church. Route

We then scooted home and prepared for the Boxing Day party at our house. 31 people were due!

Needless to say it was manic, but Ma Ma kept it together with some games. All the children played nicely with each other. I think Felicity and Eva's mums are going to get a shock when they arrive home with their hair and makeup done!

The grown up corner

The games room

The games room

It was a 5:30am start for the children. They were under strict instructions that parents could only be woken after 6am with a cup of tea. Bang on 6am teas were delivered and all settled in Ben's bedroom to begin opening what Father Christmas had delivered. Exactly 17 presents each!

After it was Daddy and Mummy's exchange of gifts. A shift of venue to their bed. Mummy loved her wet suit, Fat Face jumper, calendar, Next jumper, socks, nighties, and what seemed to be a problem; a bobble hat.... which she did ask for, but not in blue!

Oops. A blue (not white or black) bobble hat

Daddy gets crisps

Daddy received a new pair of Asics running trainers, some foody bits and a running and biking magazine as well as a bike bag.

Stage 3 of Christmas Day present opening was to take place by the tree downstairs. These were presents from friends. We got some place mats from the Sanders, some cups of chocolates from the Kelley's and some lovely smellies from the Teales.

Friends present opening

A little lull in proceedings before a 9:30 exit to the Fars for breakfast and stage 4.We had a lovely spread of danish baked rolls and bread, fruit, and some nice coffee..... before our traditional game of Coppit. This year Jessica was victorious with her cowardly custard tactics! Daddy opened a couple of presents from the Fars before we moved on to Gravesend.

Christmas Breakfast

We arrived at Istead Rise at 1:30pm and sat down to eat with the Elders and Maisey's at 2:30pm. First year we all sat at the same table. It was the traditional huge turkey and all the trimmings. After we walked to Andrea and Rich who were properly waiting for us. Rich had deployed his drone to track us..... then had rigged up his hose pipe to squirt us from his phone!

Christmas Lunch

Ben outside Andrea and Rich's

Stage 5 - the manic kids presents opening.

Ben's face opening his Quad Bike experience

Stage 6 was adults opening their presents.

In the evening we played games. The game that everyone liked was called 'Codenames'. We all had a good go at it. Some better than others!

A good day had by all.

We played games in the afternoon before heading over to the Fars at about 4pm. We had the usual fare of a treasure hunt around the Tomlins estate, a quiz, Danish Christmas dinner, the dice game and present opening.

Farmor and Jessica

The dice game

Present time

Daddy and the Fars

Team line-up

In the morning Daddy was nursing a hangover on his 222nd parkrun, whilst Ben ran off ahead.

The latest out of the Berkshire walk book was a 4 miler around the muddy Mortimer countryside and the old Roman village of Calleva Atrebatum. Katie came suitably dressed in her heels! In the last mile there was a stream to cross and she managed to end up in it... we later discovered there was a bridge that we could have used to cross the river!

Daddy, Mummy and Jessa

Heading towards the Roman village

Balancing act across the stream. Katie being a kind sister

In the morning we went to get our teeth checked out by the dentist. All good. Then Jessica and Katie went over to Farmor's to bake some giffler, buscuits and sneiler.

Bakers

Daddy went to meet Barrie, Michael, Phil, Nick, Steve and Martin down the Prince Of Wales. Nick announced his engagement to Suzi. Daddy wasn't too well when he returned.

POW boys

title.value: Farmor Baking - Boys Night Down the POW

info.content:
This year we went to Bills Restaurant in Camberley for our family meal.

The gorgeous girls

Bills, Bills, Bills

In the morning Daddy surprised Katie by doing her paper round in the freezing conditions. He then went off to marshall in the Jingle Jog held on the Green.

FF Marshalls

The rest of us went down to Hayling Island and met up with the rest of the family. We saw Father Christmas in the Winter Wonderland, then on to the fairground rides.

Meeting Hayling Islands Father Christmas

title.value: Hayling Island Winter Wonderland, Jingle Jog marshalling

info.content:
Daddy went to parkrun in the freezing cold and ran a 24:43. After he went up to Heatherside where he and Stuart called this morning's game off. Frost. After they went to the Fars, as Ben would put it, to raid their cupboards! Meanwhile Mummy went with church to the two old people's homes in St Catherines Road and sung Christmas Carols to the old folk.

In the afternoon we all went out for a family bike ride. Ben was keen to show some of the tracks we've been on previously. Jessica and Katie were not that enthusiastic and we ended up just exploring the Fuel Allotments and found the swing which was good fun.

Swinging in the woods

After a quick shopping trip, Mummy and Katie went to Gravesend for the annual Teale meal.They met up at the Woodlands along with Ma Ma and Rose. Katie and Summer sat on their own table!

The girls at Woodlands

title.value: parkrun, Carol signing, Family Bike Ride, Teale Meal

info.content:
Daddy was babysitting Toby and Lily. Daddy and Toby made bread, then had a game of pairs which ended 1-1. Meanwhile Mummy took KBJ and Joey to trampolining.

After, Daddy and Ben went to Aldershot cinema and met up with the other Frimley Flyers to see the latest Star Wars film, The Last Jedi. It was excellent. At times through it Ben was shivering with anticipation. They both loved it.

FF Rebels
The Weston girls each year meet up for a meal. Recently it's been held at the Harvester in Puttenham. This year Jessica was old enough to go. Daddy babysat Toby and Joey.

Daddy decided to go for a run.... it started out as a 10km planned run. However, he felt good enough to carry on and carry on..... then at 8.5 miles slowed up and wished he had done a shorter route. Knee pain! Anyway it was his longest run since March.

Route

In the morning Ben went with some of the Elders to see Daddy's Home 2 at Aldershot cinema. It got a thumbs up. Meanwhile Toby went along with the girls to Chris-tingle.

In the afternoon Daddy and Ben went to the Frimley Flyers end of season awards meal held at the Packhouse, Runfold. As Daddy is one of the organisers he provided the league table data and had to present to the group next year's events. In between all of that we had a very nice meal.

FF Awards Lunch

title.value: Frimley Flyers Awards Meal, Ben to see Daddy's Home 2

info.content:
In the morning Daddy went to parkrun and got a season's best time in 24:10. Ben's football was called off last minute due to the freezing conditions.

In the afternoon we had the Glidewells, Elders and Sanders over for a Children's party. Mummy had organised a load of games which the adults were also allowed to join in.

Party Games I

Evie - Give Us A Clue

Ben went to the Elders to sleep the night, whilst Toby was going to stop in with us..... however, after about 30 minutes he wanted his mum, so had to recall the Elders back to pick him up.

title.value: Gay-Glidewell-Elder-Sanders Children's party - Ben and Toby swap sleepover

info.content:
As we went around the Elders a couple of months back to see the America holiday photos, it was kind of an in-joke that we should do the same. Daddy had lined 900 photos up.

We had the Elders, Maisey's and Weston's over to bore them to tears. Needless to say the kids went out on to the trampoline in the freezing cold and dark - which was obviously their preference. The highlight was fish and chips all round.

Mummy and Daddy went out to the Net Evidence Christmas meal held at the Giggling Squid in Farnham. We sat with Tim and Krish and their partners.

Giggling Squid

Daddy went in for his first mountain bike event. He went along with Barrie, Jon and Uncle Michael. It was an early start. The 23 mile circuit wasn't too taxing - although Clay Hill (Beggars Lane) was tough. One to re-visit in better weather.

Route

Daddy and Jon at Newlands Corner

In the evening Mummy went to meet Helen and Fiona for a meal and a catch up and to collect Katie from her weekend away with Summer.

title.value: Dirty Santa, Meet with Helen and Fi

info.content:
Daddy was in a rush this morning. He helped Katie do the paperound before he headed off to parkrun. He was pleased to break 25 minutes. Katie headed off to Summer's where she spent the day with Summer going around Bluewater getting Christmas presents. They had a go on the ice rink too.

Bluewater Ice Skating

Meanwhile Daddy and Ben went to Football over in Bracknell. The Falcons won 7-1, although Ben didn't have a great game.

In the afternoon Jessica went over to Lily's 11th birthday -it was a Bake Off party. Jessica won best decorated cake. She stayed the night along with Lily's other friend, Mae.

Lily's 11th Birthday

title.value: parkrun, Football, Katie shopping with Summer, Jessica at Lily's 11th Birthday

info.content:
Mummy and Daddy went to Camberley Theatre to see and hear James Bond scores being played. Beforehand they went into an eat all you can place in the cinema complex. There must have been 20 members of the band, along with two very good singers.

Q The Music - James Bond Band

Us children went to trampolining as usual, then were looked after by the Fars.

Well what an honour. We received an invite to the Surrey Police Awards Dinner for Katie's role in standing up to the boy at school who threatened to stab another child. In short, a knife was shown and the words 'Do you want to see me stab such and such boy'. Katie and her friends told the school, the police were then involved. Over the weeks Katie friends dropped out one by one, choosing not to give evidence. Katie was the only one left. Without her preparing to testify this boy would have got off and could have caused harm. Katie got threats herself for being a witness. Probably the same to her friends, which is why they all dropped out. So Katie was being commended for carrying through what she had seen.

Programme

We arrived at Guildford Cathedral. The 50 or so guests were to have a dinner in the refectory. We sat at the table with the Chief Constable, Nick Ephgrave and another award winner and her parents. He was a very nice man and we made small talk. He said he could not eat as he got too nervous. Had butterflies.

On table next to Chief Constable

Important policeman kept coming up to Katie through out the evening commending her on her bravery. I think Katie was a little bemused wondering what all the fuss was about.

After eating, the awards began, commending police workers for long service and for heroic acts. Katie was the only civilian to receive an award. She was one of the last. She was presented and walk on to the stage where a Superintendent spent 5 minutes telling the audience of her story (see video clip). She looked confident standing on stage and we were all so proud of her. She was presented a certificate from the Chief Constable, photos taken and a big round of applause. Very well done Kaite.

Receiving Awards from Chief Constable, Nick Ephgrave

It was just boys tonight as the girls went off to Kent for some retail therapy at Bluewater on Black Friday. Katie took her friend Catherine. Mummy and Jess locked themselves out of Ma Ma's house without any spare keys. The next door neighbour was able to come along and take a window out to allow Jessica to climb in and unlock!

Daddy collected Ben from Oliver's and then we went to get chips, a Chinese and some treats from One Stop and stopped in to watch I'm A Celeb in front of the fire.

Cosy Ben

title.value: Girls to Bluey, Boys night in

info.content:
The big match between Joey and Ben.... and Mytchett came out the winners, 3 goals to nil.

After, we went around to the Elders for a yummy fry up and a play.

Lily came over to sleep and watch films with Jessica and Katie.

title.value: Alton v Mytchett, Elders for lunch, Lily Sleepover,

info.content:
Ben dressed up for Hero's day at school. He was part of a production shown to year 8's.

Ben the hero

Mytchett played a team two divisions higher than them in a cup match. They came away 4-3 the victors, played at the Police College in Bramshill. The boys rushed home and went straight out to the Kingfisher for Great Grandma's 92nd birthday meal attended by some of the Barnett's.

We swapped Katie who was staying at Summer's for the night. We had Alice to stay. In the afternoon the Elders popped over for tea and a catch up. We were a little unorganized with Fireworks. It was a last minute scramble to Ravenscote where we joined the Fars to watch the fireworks.

Whizz Bang at Ravenscote

title.value: Football, Great Grandma Birthday, Fireworks, Alice and Joey for sleepover. Katie at Summers

info.content:
Ben and Jess went out with the Panesars, Strouds and Turners Trick or Treating. Katie went out with her friends.

Spooky Jessa and Ben

Boo Hoo our final day - the flight wasn't until 11pm so we had yet almost another full day. It started with Daddy running up and down the strip for 3 miles Route, whilst the rest of us had a lie in. Before checking out we made the use of the pool once more. Daddy wasn't going to, then felt left out so just dived in with his normal clothes on! We headed out of Los Angeles and stopped off at a diner for brekkie.

We retraced a lot of yesterday's route to the Hoover Dam. Parked up and walked across the Dam and back again. It was impressive. The Colorado River seemed so far down. Mummy and Daddy took the extra walk across the motorway bridge to admire the structure from afar.

Hoover Dam

Us children were desperate to go to Walmart to get some holiday presents, so we spent an hour or so getting lost and stacking up on sweets and all sorts of things

Next stop was to see the Mermaid show at the Silverton Hotel. It was stuck out on the edge of town and it did feel a bit B-league. However, the Mermaid show was good to see. A new found love for Subway from the family meant we visited one of their establishments for din dins. We took a quick look around the 'Town Square' before heading to the famous 'Welcome to Las Vegas' sign. Unfortunately we were doing the opposite and saying goodbye. The site was used as a remembrance ground for the atrocity at Mandalay Bay just a month ago.

Farewell Las Vegas

We headed to the airport, dropped the hire car, a Toyota Camy, which we loved and wanted (but discontinued in England). We had a number of hours to kill. Daddy and Ben was drawn in by the Baseball World Series. We learnt the rules and sat, glued to the TV for 2 hours.

The plane home wasn't as fun as the inward journey. First we headed in a Delta Airlines plane (which was late) to New York where we changed to a very old Virgin Atlantic plane home.

Overall I don't think we could have fit anymore in. We certainly maximized our time out there. We didn't get a chance to watch TV or play games in the hotel rooms. A fantastic experience.

Katie 2 part VLog of the holiday.

The LA bits

Travelling to Las Vegas and beyond

The world heritage site of the Grand Canyon awaited us. We went to the closest tourist spot which was the West Rim. On the way we stopped at the fantastically named, Boulder City for some breakfast at Chilly Jilly'z. The drive down past Lake Mead and the Hoover Dam (which we didn't see) was very picturesque and the start of the Grand Canyon park. Two hours passed of monotonous, but scenic driving.

Jessica posing in front of some rocks

A little jaded from the journey, the heat and Daddy constantly stopping for photos we arrived at the Hualapai's grounds. It felt like we had reached some kind of base camp, which it was really. There were domed temporary looking buildings next to an air strip with light aircraft buzzing in and out. We parked up and took the bus to Eagle Point: the glass walkway. We had to deposit cameras in a locker before walking on the glass floored, u shaped bridge. This annoyed Daddy intensely. He let the officials know of his displeasure, and frankly ruined the experience for him. The views were good. We were on the walkway for about 10 minutes. It was a bit of a let down to be honest.

We traveled by bus on to the third stop, Guano Point, which really lifted our spirits. The views from here were so much more spectacular. There was a spit of rock which you could climb to get 360 degree views. Fantastic. Katie was a little too nervous to attempt the trek and Jess was tired. The other three enjoyed some great views.

Family +1 in a Grand Canyon shot

Time was marching on very quickly, especially after faffing around for a very late lunch. We were going to make it for the Hoover Dam so we were resigned to heading back to Las Vegas. We went directly to the strip and after another spot of retail therapy in Nordstrom, we went to the Stratosphere where Ben want to try out possibly the scariest ride in the world, called Insanity. You go 900 feet in the air, get strapped to a chair which is lent forward 70 degrees, dangled off the side of the building, and then you are spun around, pulling 3G's. Mummy closed her eyes. Ben loved it. It turns Daddy stomach just thinking about it. Brave, brave, brave. The stratosphere was in a quite rough area so once finished we quickly exited the area via some tacky gift shops.

We went to the disappointing show in the Forum and the gardens in the Flamingo Hotel. Jessica really wanted to go on an upside ride. The New York, New York Hotel had a rollercoaster going through it which went upside down. Unfortunately she was not tall enough to go on the ride! So it was left up to Daddy and Katie to take the honours. It was quite funny to experience a rollercoaster in the middle of a city. It started off high and did end up going upside down. Again another full packed day.

New York, New York

Unfortunately we had to leave Los Angeles and make the long trip to Las Vegas. We could make it simple and take the motorway route which would take about 4 hours. Instead we found a "scenic route" which takes us south through the Mojave Desert.

As we traveled along we read the guide detailing information about the towns we passed. We went past the San Bernardino mountain range with its mass of wind turbines, through 29 Palms where we tried to swim. It wasn't until we got on to the road to Amboy that we really felt were alone in the desert. The roads were straight, mountains on the horizon and a searing heat outside. At Amboy, a disused town, we saw a volcano, two massive trains and Roy's Cafe. This was the start of the old route 66. Us children weren't that impressed. We just wanted to get to Las Vegas. Daddy scooted along to Kelso and the salt flats, then the big smoke of Las Vegas. Total travel time was about 6.5 hours.

Twentynine Palms

We arrived at the vast Excalibur hotel, which was situated on the strip. It was like a fantasy hotel with a very large casino on the bottom floor. So many glorified fruit machines, the table of poker, some blackjack, craps and roulette. The hotel was so vast. Finally we got seen to and fortunately got upgraded to the Royal Tower, whatever that meant. Compared to what we had previously the adjoining rooms were luxurious. Each room had two double beds a massive shower and unfortunately a safe which Mummy put the passports and then forgot the combination code she had set! We made a quick trip to the outdoor swimming pool. What we imagined to be a typical hotel swimming pool. Curvey shape, lots of fun beds, music, a bar and a busy, shallow pool. It wasn't really us - we like a deep pool that is quiet. Still we had a nice play.

Graham's brother recommended a BBQ restaurant which we looked up, Rollin' Smoke BBQ. It was a bit off the strip and looked a real locals place. We were the only tourists in an otherwise 90% tourist town. The food was fantastic. The burnt ends were so tasty. We parked the car in a dodgy place and made the long walk through to the Mirage where we saw the Volcano show. We went through Caesars Palace where Katie purchased yet more makeup. $37 for some lippy! We eventually made it into posh Bellagio. After a little explore we stayed to see the fountain show.We were knackered, so Daddy and Katie went to get the car 2 miles away to chauffeur the tired crew back to the hotel.

Our Hotel, the Excalibur

Waiting at the Belagio for the fountain show

title.value: USA Day 8 - Road Trip to Vegas

info.content:
Another gloriously sunny day which started for Daddy in a running lap of Disneyland Route but for everyone else a Denny's and a trip to the hotel pool. There was not much enthusiasm from us children about going on a boat for 2 hours. However, hopefully they should learn to give things a chance as this would become their highlight of the holiday. We headed to Bilboa Island at Newport Beach for a two hour whale watching tour. They say whale watching, however there appears to be a 50/50 chance of seeing any whales. Bilboa Island was lovely and relaxed. Many of the holiday houses were dressed for Halloween. Alex our captain took just us on his speed boat out in to sea. Almost straight away we caught up with a pair of Fin Whales, the second largest animal in the world (behind the Blue Whale). They surfaced every couple of minutes. Alex mentioned how lucky we were to see them. Fin Whales were last seen a few months ago in these waters. They were distinctive with their fins which could be mistaken for a sharks. We tracked them for a long way eventually leaving them to head north for a pair of hump back whales. Alex said we had probably picked the best tour of the year. So lucky to see four whales. Although the whales should have been the highlight, the dolphins were the star of the show. Pods of 4 or 5 swum in front of the boat. Fantastico. Love them. At one point there were birds perched on the water, with the whales, dolphins and sea lions. We were very spoilt. After a couple of hours we had to return to harbour as our trip time was up. A fantastic experience.

The whale watching crew

Friendly Dolphins came to play

It was a double exciting day for the girls as it was shopping time. Katie had been researching stores to visit for the past I don't know how many months. There was a Sephora a few miles away in Huntington Beach. Whilst Katie was spending over $300 on make-up (didn't know that was possible), the boys enjoyed the crashing waves and quiet beach.

The hunk at Hutchington Beach

The main shopping event was still to come. We headed back to Orange County and went to its outlet mall. It was like bees around honey. Katie bought so much, even the boys go on in the action! It must have been close to a $1000 total spend. It puts a shudder down my spine.

Girly shopping time

In the evening we headed to the Packhouse for an evening meal. It was recommended by Alex, our captain, as a quirky, trendy place to eat. He wasn't wrong. Mummy had her two favouite meals on a plate: Chilli and Mac. In contrast to the excesses today we were spooked out by a homeless person who was going around the petrol station we had stopped at begging. Such ends of the scale. We felt very sorry for him.

It was an end to another long day which probably in isolation was our favourite.

title.value: USA Day 7 - Whale Watching and Shopping

info.content:
No driving. Hooray. After breakie, we got to Disneyland for the 9am opening. We had a lot to fit in once we arrived on the monorail. The list of rides were: Matterhorn Bobsleigh, Space Mountain, Pirates Of The Carribean, Inidiana Jones Adventure, Jungle Cruise, Autopia, Finding Nemo Submarine Voyage, Alice In Wonderland, Start Tours: The Adventures. None were thrill rides, but it wasn't about that today. The main event, The Parade included loads of characters dancing through the streets. It was quite spectacular. Not quite Frimley Green carnival! We stayed till gone 9pm, so had a full day here. We stopped off at a diner on the way back to the hotel for dinner. After we dipped in to the hotel pool before bed.

Splash Mountain

Iconic Sleeping Beauty's Castle

Tinytoon magical land

A right Micky Mouse lot

After breakfast at Denny's we went for a swim in the hotel pool. Another trip north along the horrendous trafiic this time to Hollywood itself. Another really hot day. The car reported it to be 42 degrees and for the first bit of the day we had to wear 'pants'. We were at the foot of the Hollywood sign hill - it was not easy to get a good photo oppotunity for sign. There were many trees or buildings in the way.

Obligitory Hollywood sign shot

We got to Sunset Ranch for our horsey ride up near the Hollywood Sign. It was like we had reached a different world. The atmosphere was very relaxed and felt like we were cowboys with our horses. Curtis our guide, sized us up at the stables for our one hour trip along the mountain path. Mummy got a horse which was a little lively at first. It was lovely that we were all doing the same thing. First time on horse for Jessica and Ben, and both did ever so well. First bit was a steep incline which Jessica's horse, Magic, decided to trot. It would have freaked the rest of us out, but not Jess, she gave her a little well done 'pat'. The horses were walking right on the edge of the road. One false slip and we would be down the mountain. Funnily enough we all thought what would happen if the horse was suicidal! Then Curtis mentioned how birds and snakes can startle the horses! It made for not a completely relaxing ride. However, it was a lovely experience and one of Daddy's best of the holiday.

A bunch of cowboys and girls

We headed into Hollywood itself and went for a walk up and down Hollywood Boulavard to see the Chinese Theatre and all the stars on the pavement. We stopped off for a much needed drink and lunch in an air conditioned trendy cafe.

Next we went for a drive in the car. First down Sunset Boulavard, then through to Beverley Hills which was very neat and tidy with big, expensive houses. Rodeo Drive was a narrow street with all the top shops. It almost looked fake. We just drove past admiring the expensive-ness of it all.

Next was a longer than expected drive through the residential parts of Bel Air. Another posh suburb. Not much traffic and wound our way up the hill to the top of Stradella Road. We were trying to spot famous peoples houses. Ben and Katie reckoned they saw some big You Tubers house.

It was a painfully long journey back to the hotel due to the traffic again, we went via the infamous Compton. A quick swim before going to the Italian next to the hotel and then walk over to Downtown Disney. There was a Lego, Build A Bear and Star Wars shops. A couple of street bands played which entertained the boys whilst waiting for the girls to appear from the make up shops.

Our Pumpkin

We headed north again, but as the traffic was so bad we went through Los Angeles. It was nice to actually see something other than a motorway. LA looked pretty poor on the whole. We saw the Hollywood sign for the first time on the way through. Eventually we made it to Universal Studios, parked up and headed in on this very hot day.

There were loads of simulator based rides, which sound not as good as the coasters, however, they were done really well. Also we all stuck together as we could all go on everything. We experienced the rides in The Simpsons (simulator), Harry Potter and the Forbidden Journey (simulator), Revenge Of The Mummy (rollercoaster), Transformers (simulator), Dispicable Me (simulator), Jurassic Park (boat flume) and of course the studio tour which took about an hour included driving into a couple of tunnels and watching fast action movies portrayed all around you. The 'Waterworld' show was very entertaining. Pyrotechnics, speed boats, acrobatics and a fantastic set. Mummy got the wetest as we all sat in the seats designated for being drenched. Overall, we had a great time here, the queues were not too long, prices not too bad. I think Harry Potter land stole the show. The street looked fantastic. Ben bought a wand from Ollivanders. We also tried Butterbeer, however the hard to describe taste didn't go down too well with us all.

As ever we stayed from opening time right up to closing time, so maximised our stay. Outside there was a shopping mall with various shops that took our interest. We sat and ate at Bubba Gumps. Daddy of course had the shrimp.

The Universal Globe

Harry Potter land

Ollivanders

We took it a bit easier this morning. After a Denny's breakfast, we utilized the hotel swimming pool and jacuzzi. We had it to ourselves and the weather was glorious. Half an hour later we were on our way north again, battling through the LA freeway traffic and reached Venice Beach - home of Muscle Beach. We strolled along the promenade popping into the various t-shirt and souvenir shops. We bought some sunglasses and t-shirts. Some purchases were better received than others! Ben and Daddy watched locals play basketball which was very interesting and tried some of the apparatus around Muscle Beach. The gym at Muscle Beach was very disappointing. It looked weathered and empty. It had seen better days. Ben beat Daddy in a race up the climbing ropes.

We hired a tandem for the boys (Route) and rollerskates for the girls. We had fun for an hour doing our activities. One thing that did strike us was the waft of marijuana everywhere and the number of homeless people. Time was marching on so after Daddy did a quick run (Route), we got back into the car and traveled north up to Santa Monica. It took ages to find somewhere to park. We walked about a mile along the sea front to the brightly lit pier passing some more apparatus to play on. We strolled around the pier and ate at a restaurant with some traditional fare.

Tandem for the boys

Tropical views

Mr Muscle on the beach

Skates for the ladies

Sunset walking to Santa Monica pier

title.value: USA Day 3 - Venice Beach, Santa Monica

info.content:
We woke fairly early. Needing to shake off the jetlag. UK time it's mid afternoon.... west coast time: 7am! We headed over to Denny's (American version of Little Chef) for breakfast. Not a lot of healthy options. The menu choice remained fairly consistent over the next 7 visits.

We headed north in the heat and terrible traffic and eventually reached Magic Mountain, high up on the list in Ben's book. There were over a dozen rollercoasters. Some where you lie flat, lie on your back, stand up, go 100 mph, highest loop. The queues into the park were long, the queues in the park were also long. We mixed it up a bit as Jessica was too short for a lot of the rides that Katie and particularly Ben wanted to go on. Ben and Katie went on: Batman, Superman, Goliath, The Riddlers Revenge and Full Throtle. The rides were very good and we stayed until after dark. It was fright night, so there were characters dressed up roaming the streets going around scaring the park One of the characters came running in and slid on his knees to scare us. Jessica didn't take too kindly to that. We were all very tired by the end. It was a struggle for Daddy to make it home in the car awake.

About to go on first coaster of the day

Goliath at night

title.value: USA Day 2 - Six Flags Magic Mountain

info.content:
Us children had the day off school to go on our long awaited USA holiday. We have been saving and putting off this holiday for over 4 years! Katie had plucked up the courage to take the long flight to the west coast of America. Gemma had helped us book the flights and accommodation. As a result we flew with Virgin Atlantic, a highly respected carrier. All the packing done, Daddy drove us to the Purple Parking place right by the runway.

All was going smoothly, passing the bags in, going through the security gates..... and then Daddy had this 'Did I leave the Iron On type thought' about his insulin. He had planned to pack 2 sets of insulin, one as a contingency. As the bags had been checked in he couldn't verify if he had enough. He was so worried he phoned Farfar to go to our house, take an insulin from the fridge and drive to Heathrow Terminal 3 and somehow get it through security. At this stage there was an hour and a half till take off. However, traffic was not great and time marched on. It trotted on so much that Katie who had gone through to board began sobbing, the flight info stated the gate was closing and still no insulin. Daddy had arranged with security for the insulin to be passed through as Farfar was not allowed to present in person. It finally came, 20 mins before take off. Now the dash to the plane. Of course gate 22 one of the furthest away and to add to the problems, the Heathrow staff shut off the walk way to allow passengers to exit other planes. It was very frustrating as Daddy was in a rush. Eventually he ran through and was one of the last on to the plane much to the relief of everyone, well at least Katie.

Final call for the dipstick

The plane journey was a lengthy 11 hours, but food and drink were regularly distributed and the entertainment system kept us largely occupied. We all watched a number of films, except Daddy who watched documentaries. Boring!

Having arrived it took an age to get through passport control. We picked up the bus and headed to the car rental place. By now we were tired, it was dark outside and we had another lengthy queue. Mummy was accused of being rude when she 'chucked' the id documents to the lady handling our car. Of course we got stung for extra charges. $100 for the toll road machine.... which I don't think we needed in the end.

Driving on the other side of the road, after a long flight in Friday night rush hour on 7 lane motorways was a test. It took over an hour to get to the Best Western hotel in Anaheim. Once there we collapsed into bed and slept well.

Are planned LA excusrsions

It was Oli's birthday party at lunchtime. He had a football party at the 3G pitch at Frimley Lodge.

Virginia Water Totem Pole

Later in the afternoon we went out to Virginia Water to complete Jessica's homework on North America. We walked to the totem pole.

Daddy park runned in the morning before rushing off with Ben to Football over in Hindhead. The Falcons won by a record 9-0. It could have been more if Daddy and Loz hadn't changed the team around so much in the second half. A great team performance.

In the afternoon Katie fell ill, which wasn't to leave her for 4 days. She returned to school on Wednesday.

Last weekend, mummy decided to wash the rug by the fire, which fell apart in the washing machine and clogged the drainage up. Daddy has tried all week to fix it, and enough was enough and a new washing machine was purchased for Â£380

In the evening Ma Ma and Pop Pop came over and stayed the night as they had to leave early for a camping trip in Tenby.

title.value: New Washing Machine, Ma Ma + Pop Pop Sleepover

info.content:
After school and work we met up with Joey, Lily and Ellie to watch Joseph and the Technicolor Dreamcoat at Richmond Theatre.

The advert

The audience

• Another sunny day.
  • Dawg somehow not losing the deposit on the bike despite wrecking it.
  • Another lap around the day 1 route.
  • Kingster navigating. "Just follow the road. It's simple"
  • Kingster comes to the rescue with Wing Mirror photo
  • Dawgs dodgy iPhone and song selection. Anyone heard of Bluetooth?
  • Wait to hand bikes over at airport.
  • Copious amounts of methane.
Route

Xalon Krew

Trio doing Castell de Castells route

Day 4 collage

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 4 - Castell de Castells

info.content:
• Solid poker victory for Dawg. (Slop and Mike losing run continues)
  • Slop challenging for a top two finish - Leicester is disguise?
  • Dawg breaks his bike in spectacular fashion.
  • Bazza, Dawg, Jonah lock themselves out. Maria's son abseils through roof to save them. A lot of finger pointing!
  • 13% incline.
  • 25 degrees and sunny
  • We all somehow meet up near Benigembla for lunch and all ride home together. "Will you get out of my slipstream" ~ Dawg
  • Dawg wears shorts normally, bur decides on long trousers for bike rides!
  • Another Slop puncture. Side wall. Mountain climb on 30 psi, and decent again on front
  • brakes only. New tyre needed.
  • BBQ
Route

Stunning views over the coast

Off roading down track after Val d'Ebo

BBQ meal

On the Mikey train

Collage of today

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 3 - Val d'Ebo

info.content:
• Will he, won't he? Dawg and cycling. Bet he wished it was a "won't he".
  • Dawg falling over in puddle, destroying his cleats.
  • Calpe Monsoon and the hill back home
  • Dawg smacking his head on the wall. (Knocked some sense in/out of him? You decide.)
  • Dawg Â£20 cleat purchase
  • Slop biking 70 odd miles on 30psi rear tyre. E'ster suggesting to pump it up.... It went down!
  • Epic 9000 ft climbing day.
  • Gravel tracks and mega steep inclines - Lake Guadalest.
  • Another nice meal at the same restaurant.
  • E'ster - an eating machine. Indigestion
  • Nobody passing the man test of getting TV channels properly working
  • Mike continually wimping out of the Calpe route.
  • Bazza taking a fall
  • Dawg discovering party trick of using arse to turn shower on/off/up/down in front bathroom.
Route

Oh no not again

Where are my teeth

Collage

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 2 - Coll de Rates, Lake Guadalest

info.content:
• Dawg loses wallet and has minor heart failure!
  • All turn up late at airport (E'ster, Robin, Jonah, Dawg, Bazza)
  • Excessive queueing for car rental (E'ster). + bike wandered off
  • Mike takes good manners to new levels letting everyone in front of him in queue
  • Minor Mike sulk when organising effort is questioned and bike goes AWOL.
  • Baz alerts the king and dawg that they are at wrong (south) terminal
  • Kingster , not for the first time pushes in to queue, at airport
  • Mike having audacity to blame Robin for his failure to take a run out in the bus to check on safety of fellow rockets
  • Terrible navigation. Which lane? (Robin)
  • Maria kisses. Dawg almost slipped a tongue in there!
  • Amazing villa
  • Cycle cafe for Tapas and beers (well Dawg and Slop)
