  • Dawg always using Robins bathroom. Flooding it after showers!
  • 20 mile loosener through Pinos. Erm Not. Pitch black 8 mile decent.
  • Slop double puncture repair in dark. Decent only with front brakes. Bazza and Dawg appear out of the dark from nowhere.
  • One front light between 4 of us in the pitch black. Pity bus never arrived!
  • Lovely meal out at Restaurant.
Route

Costa Blanca

title.value: Costa Blanca Bike Holiday Day 1 - Serra de BÃ¨rnia

info.content:
Daddy and Ben went out with the Turners and Stroud's for a Swinley MTB run. This time everyone stayed on their bikes, although Ben did managed a double puncture near the end of proceedings. Conditions were a little tricky down to the damp ground. We all enjoyed it, although I think the boys got a little tired due to the footballing exerts yesterday.

Route

Meanwhile Jessica and Mummy went to church.

In the afternoon we left Daddy at home and we went shopping into Camberley to get some bits. Ben a new headset for the PS4, and the girls makeup.

In the evening the Fars came over to babysit as Mummy and Daddy were given tickets from Ma Ma and Pop Pop to see John Challis at Camberley Theatre. He spoke about his professional life which was quite interesting.

John Challis, Camberley Theatre

Daddy and Ben had an early start going off to Alice Holt parkrun which Daddy ran. It was a tough course. They caught up with the Henderson's which they've not seen for a while. We might meet up next summer to the Henley Mile.

Route

After, the boys moved on to Bordon for their first match of the season, although the team's second. We played Wey Valley who beat us narrowly last week. Daddy was joint manager with Loz (Jayden's Dad). Quite a lot to organise. Ben started as sub as recommended by Daddy, as he was the only player not to turn up last week.

The team played really well, and we won 4-0 in the end. Ben scored the crucial second goal..... with his head. Unbelievable! Smallest person on the pitch. Anyway Big Man was the word of the day as some of the oppo were teasing him because of his height..... he had the last laugh. Daddy got a lot out of it, proud to see the boys play together as a team. No Pre Madonnas.

After a shower and lunch we went over to Auntie Susan's and Grahams house to see their new extension and join in their 40th birthday celebrations. The Fars were there as well as Graham's parents and brother's family. Graham had been cooking the BBQ since midnight last night! The pulled pork was sublime. Farfar had setup a treasure hunt and find the cards for money game!

Phone call received in treasure hunt

Tremear's extension

title.value: Alice Holt parkrun, Mytchett Football, Susan and Graham's 40th birthday

info.content: In the evening we went over to the Elder household along with Char, Ma Ma and Pop Pop to see the ultimate US holiday slideshow. There was a lot of micky taking, mainly at Pop Pop's expense. How pictures of a pelican do you need?

Daddy travelled up with James, Chris and Darren and met Duncan, whose birthday it was, to Kingston. A cheeky beer before hitting the Hippodrome for a rather late 10:30pm start of Feeder. It was a long time ago since Daddy last saw them live. Maybe 20 years! Anyway it was unusual. It was a small venue and hadn't been advertised too much so we got near the front. We got a free Best Of double album on CD and it was just a 40 minute set with no Buck Rogers!

Cheeky beers

Anyway Daddy got amongst it in the Mosh Pit. Love it. It was a late one home

Small stage, near the front

Feeder Flyer

A relatively relaxed and quiet day. Well except from having to get up at 6:30am because Katie was really pushing to go for an open water swim. So we all went along and went in, except Daddy who had a bad neck. Even Farmor came along and had a go. We down to the Quays, paid our monies, put on our wet-suits and in we popped.

Crazy swimmers

Mummy and Jeesica on the final leg

Farmor braving it without a wet suit

No turning back from there

Farmor went in for just a bit as she didn't have or want a wet suit on. The ones with full wet suits said they didn't even get cold. The water was a frosty 15 degrees and the organizers said this was their final session of the year, as it just gets too cold. Ben and Katie had wet-suit issues so came in after 20 minutes. Jessica was loving it and swum a complete circuit.

We finished up and was home at 8am, inviting the Fars a cup of tea to warm up. The fire went on!

Later in the morning Mummy and Ben went off to church, leaving Daddy to do jobs and the girls to design our house on Sims 4!

After a Sunday roast, Ben met up with Yuv in Camberley. After a Frenchies, they went to Yuv's to play and were joined by Oliver.

title.value: Early morning outdoor swim, church, Ben into Camberley

info.content:
A lot of effort, expense and organisation had gone in to this weekend. The plan was to Kayak from Kimmeridge Bay to Durdle Door and back again. Everyone made it, except from us! We set out on time at 8am, but after half an hour we were stuck in a horrendous traffic jam on the M3. The police had shut the motorway and the surrounding area was gridlocked. Cars had stopped and we went out and played 'it' on the fast lane of the motorway! Four and a half hours later we managed to crawl off the motorway. A further 20 minutes to get around the roundabout and back home again... well not quite

Go and play on the motorway

The girls went to the church fair whilst the boys headed to Velmead Road in Fleet and decided to do 6km of kayaking. The 3km time out was 33 minutes. The target was to do 30 minutes on the way back..... and we managed it. Ben did really well on the way back, only resting once or twice.

Route

Kayaking the Basingstoke Canal

We all met up at home and as were going to have Fish and Chips in Swanage, we kept to out word but had them at home instead!

title.value: Gave up after 4.5 hours on the motorway, Kayak and Church Fair

info.content:
In the morning Ben and Daddy joined Kieran and Barrie on a jaunt to Rogate... at first. We heard it was a downhill course, but it was a black run and it was wet. The dads took one look at thought it was too dangerous. Kieran and Ben of course didn't. Anyway after watching other go down, they quickly moved on to QE Park where there was a red run which could be tackled. Again the wet track made the conditions a little tricky especially with the chalk and roots. About 5 miles in Ben came a cropper on the wet. Going straight, Ben hit a stone which made him slide across the chalk and he went down smacking his face on the hard surface! Ouch. It was game over for Ben. Time was up anyway. One for another day.

Route

Rogate

Crash!

Ben's final look

Ben had researched and organised his birthday present to Jessica. He read reviews for the best trampoline park in the area and out of his own money had paid for himself and Jessica to have an hours session. Rush, in High Wycombe had more than just trampolines. It had high walls, high walking poles, pugile sticks, a diving board, spinning arm, etc.. You could not get bored.

Jessica at the top of the high walking poles

If Jessica hadn't been treated enough, it was Katie's turn. She took Jessica into Camberley where they went into the arcades and a trip in Creams for some ice cream.

Creams Crew

title.value: QE Park MTBing, Jessica birthday treats

info.content:
In the morning Daddy volunteered his service at parkrun and was also able to run.... not very quickly though!

Katie went with some school friends to Thorpe Park... again! Ben tagged along. They had a great time.

Jessica, Mummy and Daddy went in to Camberley to spend some birthday money on clothes and a pair of earrings.

Jessica turned 10. We started with opening presents in mummy and daddy's bed. The strangest present request ever was.... lemons. She also opened 240 US dollars, Â£50 in vouchers, lip balm making kit, a bag, 3 pairs of leggings and a top, a jumper, a J purse, egg face game.

Jessica at 10 years old

Unfortunately it was a school day, but the class all sang happy birthday to Jessica. Daddy took a half day and when everyone returned home in the mid afternoon we all went to Liquid Leisure to go on the water based obstacle course. Normally there would be hundreds of children playing on there, however, because it was an off-peak time, we had the whole place to ourselves. It was a little cold, but the wet suits helped a lot. We had a great time. First we had a race from one end to the other. Ben won, then Jess. Mummy was definitely the least agile of us all. The 50 minutes flew by. The Fars came to watch as well which was very nice.

Inflating the fun in the water

On our way home we stopped off in Frimley Green for fish and chips. A lovely end to the day.

As a lot of Ben's friends were on their holidays in August, we postponed his party till today. He had sleep over at the Elders last night so we didn't see him until 2pm.

First Daddy met up with Uncle Steven and they went for a bike ride in the Heckfield direction.

Daddy and Uncle Steven biking

Route

In the afternoon we had 6 of Ben's friends over (Joey, Oliver, Kieran, Freddy, Jayden and Callum) at the 3G pitch at Frimley Lodge park. To keep it interesting we rotated the teams and gave points to members of the winning team. We had a longer game with extra points and a penalty comp and a long range shot comp. Joey won. The party was finished off with Ben's favourite, Domino's pizza eaten in the rain with an ice cream to finish off.

Pizza time.... in the rain

Daddy's debut as manager had to wait another week. There were not enough players to start the game. So he joined Ben at parkrun. They were alot slower than last week's run.

Defying Gravity

Gone to Donalds

Jessica started yesterday in year 5 with a new 21yo teacher!

Both Ben and Katie were starting today.

School Daze
Ben and Katie were dropped off at Thorpe Park by Far Far who also took Jayden. They had a good time.
Jessica was taken out by Farmor to Camberley where they went shopping for a swimming costume and had a nice lunch.

Ben and Daddy went with Kieran and Barrie to Swinley Forest to ride some of the red trails. Ben loved it. Daddy had a pathetic 'off'.

Route

Ben going down Red 25

The girls went to church.

Straight from church we went off to Hayling Island. The weather was terrible. Needless to say we didn't stay outside on the beach for long. Just went into Funland and Ma Ma treated us to some tokens for us to go on some rides. The wearther did not improve so ended up in the cafÃ© for treats.

Ma Ma and Pop Pop stayed over ours as they were going to take out Great Grandma out tomorrow.

Ben and Jessa

Bumper Cars

title.value: Swinley MTBing and Hayling Island family picnic

info.content:
During the week Ben targeted today for a PB parkrun. As such he went to the Frimley Flyers interval training on Tuesday and a 2 hour bike ride on Thursday. Daddy said not to eat within 2 hours of running so he got up at 6am to eat breakfast!

Anyway we arrived at FLP and conditions were good, a little hot, but not too hot that it can be used as an excuse. The plan was that Daddy (recovering fitness) would stick to the PB pace as long as he could. Also they were to start closer to the front so traffic wouldn't be an issue. The pair hurtled off keeping together for the first 2km. At the railway Ben increased his pace slightly, Daddy slowly lagging behind. After lap 1 Daddy shouted 11:30, Ben thought he said 13:30! i.e. He was on PB pace. Anyway Ben kept going, slowing slightly on lap 2 however he came in a whopping 23:22. A new PB. Over a minute better than last week, but more importantly he's 35 seconds off his quickest time. Ben was very pleased with his efforts and obviously exhausted and vowed he could go quicker.

PB Route

Ben's Rio moment

A trip down the cafÃ© and a celebration can of Rio was had. Well done Ben.

Meanwhile Jessica had a sleepover at Imogen's last night and went to her pizza party at Pizza Express this morning. She had a great time.

Mummy and Katie were at church club helping out.

In the evening Mummy and Daddy went out for their wedding anniversary meal at the Old Wheatsheaf across the road. They had a nice time. No need for babysitters. Mummy got a beautiful black dress and hoodie. Daddy got a pair of garden shoes with holes in them! The Fars gave them a lot of money also.

Pre Meal Photos (Mummy in new dress)

title.value: Ben PB parkrun, Imogen's 10th birthday, Church Club, 17th Wedding Anniversary

info.content: Ben and Jessica went to Kieran's birthday outing which was a trip to Datchett and the Liquid Leisure assault course. Think that is the third time this summer. The weather was not kind, but the guys had a good time. It was over to McDonalds afterwards where there was a hellium balloon!

In the morning Daddy and Ben were moving / sorting the new wood store that Daddy had built yesterday. All the wood from behind the shed needed shifting. Ben helped and learnt about 'manual labour'! He also used a circular saw for the first time.

On me 'barrow

Katie has a bee in her bonnet about doing an open water swim. So we looked one up and saw that you could go to one of the many reservoirs in Wraysbury. We walked about a bit to find an ideal, secluded spot, but couldn't find one, so settled to a place near the houses. Still it was quite an adventure swimming in a massive lake with no one else around.

Deep, deep water

Jessica and Daddy swam the furthest around the perimeter of the lake. Ben and Katie went in a little early, then found a raft to play with. Ben, fully clothed, then fell in! Dipstick! One to do again that's for sure.

Route

In the evening Daddy, Katie, Jessica and Ben joined the Turners for a bike ride which ended up very dark!

Tunnel Hillers

Route

Not a million miles from Theale, the walk book opened at the 1.5 miles, Hampstead Norey's walk. Shortly after starting we came to a lovely playground which had allsorts of equipment. One was a roundabout which Daddy pushed and pushed. So fast Jessica flew off!

After that little set back we continued our walk through the woods.... which to be honest could have been anywhere.

The old rocket

Route

After Daddy and Ben raced at parkrun (Ben won), the five of us went to Thorpe Park with Summer. It was a hot bank holiday weekend so it was busy. Fortunately Summer has an equivalent to a fast pass so for many of the rides we could get on fairly quickly. Katie went on Saw for the first time ever, and despite having a moment on her first go, she calmed and had 4 more goes! Ben's new favourite ride was Stealth, but sitting at the front. Jessica got scared on the Detonator (drop coaster) but loved it nonetheless. Mummy and Daddy were brave going on any of the rides. Their stomachs are not as strong as they once were. Still we had a lovely day and stayed till the very end. We got fish and chips as a treat for dinner.

Thorpe Park

We took Summer and Oliver down to Hayling Island where we went on the fairground and braved it into the sea.

Fairground fun

Meanwhile Jessica went over to stay with Alice for a day before moving on to Ma Ma's for a couple of days.

title.value: Hayling Island, Jessica over the Teale's

info.content:
After church we popped over to the Fars to celebrate his 71st birthday. We had a nice meal in the back garden followed by a game of Coppit. Some dirty tactics were employed by Ben. He took the cowardly route. Let everyone destroy each other, then appear as the victor.

71 today

The final stretch. A lovely day again. Skipped breakfast in favour of an early start as they had a plane to catch. Daddy headed off north-eastwards whilst the Fars bought the morning food. First was a lovely stop off for morgenmad in Tornby.

Weetabix bales and wind farms. That's Denmark

Great views of the west coast

Next was a fast stretch to the east coast. Daddy recorded his fastest 40km in 1hr 17mis. Not bad after 280 miles of riding. Turning left and heading North for the final 15 miles was lovely along the beach, bike only road. Daddy was surprised to see the horizon scattered with a dozen or so oil tankers. I guess it's cheaper than mooring in port. Skagen was surprisingly larger than expected and not the final stop on the map! Grenen is where the road ends where there are a million and one tourists (mainly German).

Skagen. Made it!

Oil Tanker alley

Grenen. Where the road ends

The trio took a tractor ride out to the most northerly part of Denmark and saw where the Baltic and North Sea's met. It was strange to see the waves of one sea crash against the waves of the other.

Where the Baltic and North Sea meet

Of course when 88km is recorded on the clock the temptation is to make it past the 100km mark, so Daddy decided to re-trace his steps southwards to make it 300 miles (500km) for the 5 days, at the expense of rushing southwards in the car to the airport.

Packing up

Billund was of course very quiet, the plane getting in at close to midnight, then the farce of airport pickup and parking before reaching home at 2:30am! A great trip. It has given Daddy the fillet to do some more A to B cycle tours.

Route

Route

Another good weather day. 80km planned, 103km achieved! The first meeting spot was a Aalborg where there was a lovely looking church. Whilst taking on food and drink we watched a man going around the church yard with a blow torch blitzing the weeds. One way of doing it I suppose.

Stop point in Aalborg

Then came the section to the west coast. Daddy had his own cycle road, beautiful tarmac, straight roads and full steam ahead. Daddy loved this bit as he could really motor at over 30kph. By the time he reached Blochus he was spent, meeting up with a very welcome support vehicle where he took refuge.

Onwards again and this time 8 miles of sandy beach. This proved interesting in parts along the compacted sand roads which cars freely travelled. A touch of lose sand and you were skidding all over the shop. The setting was beautiful the riding was tough.

West coast beach coming

Exiting the beach at the resort of LÃ¸kken, Daddy went the long way around to the guesthouse in Lyngby just so he could make it over 100km for the day.

Apres biking pursuits included visiting a large antiques showroom and a trip to Rubjerg Knude, a lighthouse in the middle of what seems a desert. The restaurant f choice today was the one in the townhall square in LÃ¸kken.

Hitting the desert

The lighthouse

Route

Route

We awoke to an empty hotel, but the best bit was to come. A trip 5 doors down to a proper Danish bakery. Breakfast consisted of rundestucker and 3 different pastries. We had to work those calories off. Opposite, and the reason why Farfar wanted to come to AllingÃ¥bro was a bike that went on train tracks! Interesting for the first 20 minutes, then got a bit monotonous. We went down the track, stopping at road junctions. Even Farfar and Farmor had a go. Speed was not great. Still it was a good thing to say you've done.

Train Route

On the bike train

Coming into AllingÃ¥bro station

So to the ride proper, and a bit of a recovery day after yesterday's exploits. The bottom was starting to get a bit sore on the saddle. First 13 miles of countryside to Udbyhoj was lovely. A chain link ferry took us across the 400 metre stretch of water, then onto SkÃ¸rping which had a lovely road through it..... but not discovered by Daddy until too late! The hotel was nice, having a pool and a sauna. The room was very basic.... the evening meal was fantastic. Farfar doing his usual trick of adding a design pattern to his shirt with the gravy!

Boat trip

Biking the Jutland countryside

Route

Route

Daddy was intending to do 100 miles, but though he ought to do it after reaching 75 miles. The day started with smoked salmon and scrambled egg for breakfast. Mmm.

The weather was good and Daddy made his way past the church in Ejstrupholm where some of his forefathers are buried, then onto Hampen where his Morfar grew up in the 1920's / 30's. Not sure how different it is now to be honest.

Ejstrupholm church

He made it to the railway at Vrads were they had stopped for afternoon coffee yesterday. Farfar wanted him to take the disused railway line to Silkeborg about 20 miles away. There the three met for a spot of food, before Daddy continued north eastwards out of the city towards Randers. This marked 100km into the day's ride. When he reached AllingÃ¥bro the milometer registered 75 miles. It would rude not to make it up to the 100, so continued to the coast and beach town of Fjellerup. The final 10 miles were very hard, all up hill seemingly. Still the landmark was achieved so he could rest easy. Another nice evening meal at a restaurant.

Church in Randers

Route

First sign of water at 90 miles

Route

Daddy had a 3am start, to get to Stansted by 5am.... and the airport was heaving at this time of the morning! The Ryanair flight left late, but no matter, time to catch up with some Z's.

Arrival in Billund was met by the Fars, heavy rain and a broken bike bag. Whoops sorry Bob. Then Daddy sheepishly spread himself out in a cafe area and took about 30 mins to re-build the bike which he took out on the plane.

Starting from the airport

So pushed out into the rain and off we go..... well firstly the wrong way down a one way thoroughfare into the airport. The rain was absolutely hammering down which played havoc with the phone which was required for navigation. A few wrong turns on the way out west, past Legoland. The roads were smooth, empty and no pot holes! This positive news far outweighed the stupid weather. Anyway the Fars shadowed Daddy all the way to the rented house in Ejstrupholm. It was lovely and spacious inside. A much need shower was taken and then a hop out to the village and onto Vrads where the traditional Layer Cake on the old station went down ever so well. In the evening we went out for a nice meal.

Route

Route

title.value: Denmark - Day 1 - Fly Ride to Ejstrupholm

info.content:
We awoke with the tradition of having breakfast in Mummy and Daddy's bed and some present opening. Ben got lots of dollars for this year's holiday to America. He also got 'normal' money, a Thorpe Park annual pass and some PlayStation credits.

At lunchtime we went to Alice Holt to first have a picnic, then finally attempt Go Ape. Previously Ben had his leg in a cast. Ben, a nervous-ish Katie and Daddy scaled the heights of trees, whilst Mummy and Jessica went around the smaller obstacle course. Things were going well for the main crew until the rain got heavier and heavier. Then a full on thunder and lightning storm manifested just at the same time we were tackling the big cargo net.... at which point Katie lost one of her shoes. The lightening was freaking her out. Daddy was instructed to turn back, leaving the panic-striken Katie to her own devices. Ben was loving it. Anyway we were told that the place was closed until the thunder storm passed. We decided to end it there and come and finish another day.

Picnicers

Happy Birthday to Ben, Happy ....

Tree Climbers

Ape scaling tree

In the evening Katie was to present her present. We had erected the tent and Katie made it all special with Ben's favourite foods: Dr Pepper, Wether's Original, Dominoes Pizza, Popcorn, Pringles and toasted marshmallows which were cooked over the previously unused chimnea. Ben, Katie and Jessica all slept in the tent that night.

Happy Campers

It was nice to have a semi lie in. Daddy, Ben and Jessica went out with the whole Turner clan for a mountain bike trek around the Tunnel Hill area.

The crew

The Goonies

Katie went to Alice's 14th party at the Quays. She did paddleboarding, which she was more interested just diving from and Ringo'ing, which is when a speed boat drags an inflatable ring around the lake. She had a great time.

title.value: Mountain Biking, Katie Paddleboarding and Ringo-ing

info.content:
Ben and Daddy went to parkrun. Ben was hoping for a sub 25 minute, but came in at 26:02. He was a bit disappointed, but he's not run for 2 weeks. Nothing comes for free!

We were on our way to Weymouth, and took the opportunity to break up the journey by doing one of the walks out of the book. This was walk 93 based around Romsey town centre. The weather was not great, showers. The walk began in the town centre and we decided to share a portion of chips between the five of us. Best chips ever! This fuelled us well over the 4 mile circuit of Tadburn Lake and the housing estates of East Romsey! Route

By the end the weather was really closing in, so it was good to get in the car and head to the coast.

Jessa - The Romsey Flick

Daddy is a well sized raincoat

Animated discussion

Our first cousin third removed, Charlie had organised a surprise 50th birthday party for her Mum, Emma. It was held at her house in Weymouth. We arrived 3 hours into the party. As Emma was a hardened punk in the 80s, we all dressed in punk outfits. OK, maybe it was a bit of a stretch to say we dressed up. Daddy was the only one brave enough to put some headgear on. Black clothing was about the closest we came! Everyone else at the party looked the part. There was a massive gazebo in the back garden which was a bit of luck as it was chucking it down outside. It was to chat to Alan and Tina. I'm amazed at how Tina is so strong with all her medical issues. Strong as an ox. Good on her. She was entertaining as ever. Alan was recalling his trip to Abu Dhabi last year with James and Iolanda. Sounded amazing. Chatted to Gary and some of his friends and of course Emma. The Bullen family are very close nit, living seemingly within a mile of each other. We saw Jack's new addition to the family, Eve briefly. It was really good to catch up with everyone for Daddy. It only happens once in a blue moon. Charlie really made us feel welcome.

Daddy and Charlie (his first cousin, 2nd removed)

The Fars with the Quick's and Linda (on right).

Us with the birthday girl

We stayed for about 2.5 hours and left for home. Daddy was buttered up and done like a kipper and was persuaded to take a detour to Romsey again to get fish and chips from that nice shop from earlier in the day!

Went for a quick 2 hour spin in Tunnel Hill with the Turners.

Uncontrolled entrance and slide at the bottom

Front wheel briefly leaves the ground and for a moment looks a bit worried!

Katie started her birthday with a double paper round with Daddy in not so nice weather. Still cannot pass up a chance for Â£6.Jessica had then prepared a spa for Katie in the bathroom, complete with candles, melted chocolate and popcorn. It was only 7:30 in the morning!

Jessica prepared spa

Mummy had prepared a breakfast table downstairs for a change where we had croissants and summer fruits. Card and present opening. Now Katie has had a lot of presents over the past few months we've said would count towards her birthday including a new double bed, a Thorpe Park annual pass plus others. Anyway she had a shopping trip in the morning to Primark and New Look where she picked out some clothes and make-up.

Card opening

When we returned home, Summer arrived as a nice surprise. Just in time for us all to go to Pizza Hut which mummy skillfully navigated us to (not!).

Pizza Hut

On the way home we dropped off Katie, Jessica and Summer off at a nail bar in Frimley. Jessica had a manicure and Katie some acrylic nails stuck to her fingers!

Nail bar, nail bar

Daddy brought Katie home, told her to look in the shed where the surprise party guests were hiding! Surprise! Katie's grandparents and great grandma along with the Elders came to celebrate Katie's birthday. Mummy prepared some games, including spoons, a silent auction and PiÃ±ata. Daddy was on BBQ duties.

Surprise party

Later in the evening Mummy and Katie watched the final of Love Island!

In the morning Daddy and Ben went for a 3 hour MTB expedition with Kieran and Barrie.

In the afternoon we went off to Haethrow to welcome back Ma Ma, Pop Pop, Ellie and Lily from America.

Daddy solo park runned this morning.

Later in the afternoon we picked another walk out of the book. This was a short walk around Hosehill Lake in Theale. We visited Steve and Joyce on our way home.

Hosehill Lake walk

Meanwhile Katie went with Catherine to Thorpe Park for the day. Katie actually tried some of the scarier rides for the first time. They had to leave early due to the bad weather.

title.value: Walk 92: Hosehill Lake, Katie Thorpe Park

info.content:
Today marked the end of year for Katie and Ben. Jessica finished yesterday. In the evening Katie had organised a birthday meal at Bella Italia with 5 of her school chums.

Bella Italia

Catherine stayed for a sleepover after.

title.value: School's Out for summer, Katie Birthday Meal

info.content:
Since Christmas Katie has been rehearsing as Jack's Mother in the production of 'Into The Woods'. She joined mainly because her friend Catherine invited her along. She's been going every Tuesday evening for the past 6 months.

Katie was quite nervous beforehand. She was confident about remembering her lines. It was the singing that she was most nervous about. We gathered quite in the audience: The Fars, Uncle's Graham and Loz, Auntie Susan and Charlotte.

Main characters

Katie had a reasonably large part which included some singing. In the first act, which lasted over an hour, Katie played a poor version of Jack's mother.

A poor Jack's mother

Speaking bit

In the second act Katie played a rich version of Jack's mother and died 20 minutes in!

A Rich Jack's mother

Katie did ever so well. We were all very proud of her. She came out very happy but was convinced she couldn't sing. Daddy thought she did ever so well.

In the morning Daddy and Ben when mountain biking with Oliver and Kieran and their dad's. Ben managed to fall off his bike twice in uncontrollable descents! He managed to break the gear shifter and front brake.

First boys MTBing action

We went to meet with the boy Elders in Hartney Whitley for a spot of fruit picking. Katie waited in the car, with the keys left beside her. She was tapping and swiping away on her phone.... not realizing the keys were next to her. In the previous car we had to lock the car from the inside, so she continued this habit..... locking the keys in the car!

Oh dear. Daddy tried ringing the Fars, to no avail. After the fruit pick, there was no other answer but Michael had to drive Daddy home. He got home, but the spare keys to get into the house were not left in the secret hiding place. So now locked out of the house as well! Fortunately (or not, depending on viewpoint), the upstairs bathroom window was ajar. The upstairs bathroom window however is directly above the conservatory. Yes, daddy got a ladder, carefully drop on the glass roof and slowly managed to crawl through the window! Got the spare set of car keys and rode his motorbike to rescue the fruit pickers!

Raspberry pickers

Beautiful Katie

Sharing a joke

The youngsters eat one, put one in the bucket

Del Boy

Daddy and Ben went to parkrun in the morning. Both ran hard and got into the 25 minutes area. Ben wanting to knock off 1:15mins over the next 5 / 6 parkruns to get a new PB.

Katie had all day rehearsals in Camberley for her impending performance at Camberley Theatre.

Meanwhile, Mummy, Jessica and Ben went swimming after a spot of shopping, whilst Daddy got his haircut.

Arena Action

Katie entered her picture from Boscombe beach huts into a school competition for year 9 and 10's and came third. She also came back saying she got a distinction in a 'Child Development'. Well done Katie.

Third place certificate

title.value: Katie comes 3rd out of 180 in photo competition

info.content:
Breakfast in bed for Daddy and us all as well as some present opening. Daddy's main present was the white water rafting, but also got some food stuffs, some running gear and a cycling magazine.

After work, Daddy was treated to a 3 course meal, each of us selecting a course. Starters was a prawn cocktail, followed by lamb shank and rhubarb crumble. Yum.

The fars popped over later on in the afternoon and gave their presents, had a cup of tea and went through some of the Denmark holiday.

Blowing out the candles

First stop parkrun. Ben ran off from the start and left Daddy in his dust. Ben got 25 minutes as opposed to Daddy's 27.

The car stresses took a notch down after finally securing a car that seemingly works. Much to the distaste of us children, we've got exactly the same car as before, other than it's in better condition and slightly younger! Anyway we've had enough about cars this week! Mega stressful.

Daddy had his surprise birthday present.... a trip to Lee Valley White Water Centre. We are all booked in for a white water rafting

It was the inaugural Frimley Flyers BBQ / Handicap event held at Frimley Lodge Park. The idea is that the runners complete the 5km parkrun course, all set off at different times depending on their expected pace. In theory everyone should finished together. Daddy was injured, but Ben set off with an expected time of around 26 minutes. He struggled on lap 1, but settled his breathing on lap 2 and stormed a sub 25 minute finish..... and WON.

After the race, there was a BBQ and a big game of rounders. A successful event.

Ben's winning plate

Flyers lineup

Meanwhile the girls went off to Istead Rise for a Weston BBQ. It was nice to see Heather and Christine. We had a big water fight.

Weston BBQ

Daddy and Ben went for parkrun this morning and was knackered at the end despite it being a slow 28:30. Meanwhile the girls enjoyed a second trip to the Boot Fair at Mytchett.

In the afternoon Daddy went with James and Emma up to London meeting with Duncan, Kelly and Heather to watch Green Day.

Green Day stage

Rockers

Jessica competed in a number of events on Sports Day. One of which was the sprint hurdles which she won!

Daddy took a day off work to look around for a replacement car. The Astra (MH05 KPF) was up for an MOT next month and needed Â£700 of work on it. It was also car insurance time, hence we were prompted to quickly get a new car. The list of cars were whittled down to 3 essentially. 2 x Toyota Corrolla Versos and a Honda FRV. Daddy spent a day going around dodgy, West London car sales garages, decided initially against the car he eventually got just because of the colour and all the after market additions. Funnily enough it was a rival car salesman that said it was a good deal and that he should got for it. Â£4700 later a new car was introduced to the family.

In the evening we cycled to Bellew Road for the Mytchett U12's Presentation evening. All three teams were there and award were handed out. After the BBQ there was a lads V dads football game. There is a dispute over the winners. All I can say is that the Dads scored more goals than the Lads!

Ben collecting trophy

Ben modest about his trophy

title.value: Jessica Sports Day, New Car, Mytchett U12s Presentation Evening

info.content:
Well the first treat for Mummy was the fact she could semi lie in - Daddy was on paper round duties. Then the assortment of presents ranging from new Converse shoes, swimming costume, various items of clothing and some American dollars. Breakfast was pancakes.

We went off to church then we had a Family BBQ in the back garden.

Playing games

Singing Happy Birthday

For Ben's Christmas Present he got a voucher to drive a real car around an airfield. After parkrun we scooted up to Abingdon where we met the Elders and Ma Ma and Pop Pop. Ben reckoned he was going to reach 100mph! Daddy was wondering how he was going to see over the steering wheel!

Joey had a few laps first, then Ben who was very excited. Ben said he reached 70 mph in one of the three laps in the MX5 - which was impressive. The boys then had a pro driver whizz them around the circuit in double quick time.

Ben driving!

It was Ma Ma's 65th birthday so in the evening we went to Worplesdon Place for a meal with all her children and grandchildren in attendance.

Ma Ma's blowing out birthday cake

A select few went off to the Escape Rooms in Merrist Wood. They were looked in a shipping container and had to solve clues to get out within the one hour time limit, which they managed - JUST.

Escape Rooms winning team

Ben and Lily swapped for a sleepover.

title.value: Escape Rooms, Ma Ma Birthday, Sleepover

info.content:
Jessica has a boyfriend, Daniel!

Anyway today she had a school disco, which of course was an excuse to look beautiful in public!

Disco Diva

Daddy woke first at 6am to make bread for his Dad! Then came Daddy's presents and treats. Some lovely cards and presents including a nice leather wristband with our names inscribed. We had the customary breakfast in bed.

Fathers Day present giving

Farfar with Jessica

Daddy then went around to Farfar's to make him breakfast, a big fry up! We joined a little later for a drink and some nibbles.

Daddy and Grandaddy

After church we headed off to the bottom of Box Hill where we met the Weston's / Elders for a picnic next to the River Mole. Then Daddy joined us children in a long walk to the stepping stones through the river. The walk turned into a swim. It was so hot and lovely to play in the water.

In the River Mole

Enjoying the hot river weather

It was baking hot which did not make for a pretty parkrun. Ben accompanied Daddy over the finish line in a little under 30 minutes.

Parkrun

Making the most of the weather we went down to Littlehampton and landed on the beach. Even the water was warm as we swum a bit in the sea. Katie and Jessica just relax in the water on the rubber rings.

Littlehampton Beach

Mummy said there was some good crabbing spots on the boating lake. However, there seemed little sign for this to be the case at Mewsbrook Park despite our best efforts. We tried going into town a bit and saw the Oyster Pond which was full of crabs. However, we were the only ones not to catch any. We collected them off others who were leaving. As we were about to leave Jessica emptied our bucket of crabs. In doing so I think she must of killed 1 or 2!

Jessica Crabbing

We got back home, had a BBQ and attempted to watch Pretty Woman.

Daddy took the long way home via Devil's Punchbowl today

Devils Punchbowl

Route

Day 2 and the rain fell from the skies.... but only a bit. Daddy got 4.5 hours of reasonable sleep before waking and setting off again at 6am for his third and final lap.

Lap 3

Tunnel of love for Alasdair

Flyers Lineup

Medal haul

A great event despite not running to potential, probably the most enjoyable of all the Endure's

Katie and Ben went with Catherine, Jonny and Alice to Thorpe Park. Ben went on Stealth for the first time ever and raved about it when he got back.

Jessica on the other hand went to Frenchies for Amarits 10th birthday party. When she was picked up she was singing along to the karaoke.

title.value: Endure24 Day 2, Thorpe Park, Amarit's Karaoke Party

info.content:
Third year at Endure 24 for Daddy. However, this year he was injury ridden so could not really perform as he would have liked. Arriving at 10:30 the weather was glorious. There were two Frimley Flyers teams, but some friends also entered teams, such as the Longmuir's and Fudge's. Windle Vally and Sandhurst also had representation. Daddy had brought along Anthony who lead the team off to a highly charged opening. The weather was a bit of a killer for quick times. Daddy however, did not set off until 5pm and wanted to take it easy. He posted a 50:22 on a run / walk effort. The first time he's run that distance since April. The knee began to hurt after 3km, so there was a constant battle to know whether to run and damage things further or walk.

Lap 1

Flyers Lineup

Daddy rounding the corner

The same fare in terms of banter, food, supporting, cheering occurred. Night fell and torches were on. Daddy went out for his second run at 10:30pm. This time he managed to run the whole lot including Heartbreak Hill albeit a slow pace. The knee stood up to pace a bit better this time.

Lap 2

Meanwhile the rest of us were picked up by Ellie and driven back to the Elders where we had a Summer Time Ball party in lieu of going to the real thing. We had loads of fruit and we danced our way into the evening. Mummy suffered a lot from Asthma because of Polly, so we had to return back late in the evening.

title.value: Endure24 Day 1, Summer Time Ball Party at Elders

info.content:
A month of two ago Katie had put her name down for a paper round at Candy Mix in Frimley Green as she wanted to earn money..... because she likes spending it! Well we had a phone call over the weekend and she started her 13 house paper round today.... earning Â£3 a day for a 6 day week. She had to arrive between 6am and 7am.

She's already calculated that she'd be able to take over $600 to America to spend in the malls.

Mummy went with Katie at about 6:30, and completed it in half an hour. Seemed quite easy for Katie.

Route

Katie on her round

Ben returned early from his sleepover at Freddie's.

Daddy went over to cousin Steve's house for a poker night and somehow came second and won Â£10 overall.

Dorney Lake

title.value: Dorney Lake Aqua Park, Jessica / Summer swap, Poker night

info.content:
Another glorious sunny day greeted us. We were all happy that we had an easy day's riding.... well compared to the previous days. We had another 'Eat everything' breakfast..... better than yesterdays. We rate the Woolpack Inn highly, 5 out of 5. We first re-traced some steps, back up the hill of overgrown foliage, which some little people insisted on walking! We eventually got to the excellently named Spy Bush Lane. It was open, sunny and not another sole insight.... and to top it all we had 2 miles of downhill to Abbotstone.

Spy Bush Lane Going Up

Spy Bush Lane Going Up 2

Sunny sign in Abbotstone

We then picked up the River Itchen and a tonne more gates and styles to negotiate. That is one thing we shan't miss. Even the walkers were going quicker than us. We looked a bit inexperienced as we all stood by the side of a field of cows daring each other to walk through. Then some walkers nonchalantly walked through leaving us looking a bit stupid.

Field by the River Itchen

Easton, what a lovely looking village, well the cottages all seemed to have thatched roofs, climbing plants and white walls. Postcard type of stuff. Following the Itchen, Katie slipped into the nettles and we went through some not so nice parts near motorways and main roads. Eventually we popped out by the 'The Bishop On The Bridge' and saw civilization again. Not really seen many people over the past 2 days. Anyway we parked our bottoms outside the cathedral and had a McDonalds celebration meal.

Dream cottage in Easton

More gate negotiating

River Itchen in Winchester

End of the ride at Winchester Castle

Checking the train times we had to rush to last bit to the Castle. Daddy got a bit short with the station guard as the machines didn't work and there was a queue at the ticket office. Fortunately the train was late. Daddy then instinctively told a man who was trying to be accommodating to be 'quick', as we were holding up a late train as we were piling in. The man huffed and rolled his eyes. Daddy apologised and explained!

Overall a successful trip. Super proud of everyone for completing the journey, especially Jessica on her small bike. Well done.

Route

We awoke stepping across the hallway for a lovely cooked breakfast. It setup us well for the day ahead. Like yesterday we weren't sure on the total mileage, thinking it'll be around the 20 mile mark. Mmm how wrong we were. Anyway there was a bit of a dispute over the cost of the hotel with the hotel owner, a case we later put forward to Expedia. Essentially we were quoted one price, but paid Â£37 more. We later complained to Expedia and got a refund!

Determined that this set back was not going to ruin our day, we re-traced our steps so we could re-join the book route again. Easily said that done. We hit a bridle path in a farmers field, and it was covered in stinging nettles. We didn't react too well, poor Jessica seemed to react the worst of all. It must have taken half an hour to get 200 metres. Still we survived and carried on eastwards. Then another field and the main road, A327, where we waited to cross the road, however, Jessica slipped into a nettle bush and screamed like you've never heard before. So much so that a lady came rushing out of her shop opposite. We looked for doc leaves and sat down. It took 5 or 10 minutes for Jessica to stop crying. The very kind ladies in Eversley Antiques Barn helped us by going home to get some antihistamine cream and some flapjacks! This helped and after half an hour of recovery we were off again. It was past 11am and we had travelled just 3 miles!

Jessica's leg after being stung

Recovering after being stung

We went through Warren Heath on our way to Hartley Wintney. As we approached Hartfordbridge there was a dog barking in a farm which had scared a fully grown deer, who ran and leapt right in the air immediately in front of us at a rate of knots. It was a sight to behold. Wow.

We finally reached Hartley Wintney, stopped for lunch and visited the sweet shop.... as well as the Cricketers pub.

Warren Heath

Bridging the gap

Someone put a sweet shop on our route!

The Cricketers, Hartley Wintney

Four hours in and we left the pub and we had only travelled 8 miles. We went passed the first of four St Mary's churches and headed south. We reached the Basingstoke Canal having gone over a number of gates and styles. We could finally make some progress along a gateless, flat canal towpath.

St. Mary's Church

Summer Fields

On to the Basingstoke Canal

We reached the end of the navigable canal at Greywell and in reality we were only half way in terms of mileage, maybe even less considering the hills we now had to climb! It was gone 4pm and morale was low. The realization of how far we still had to ride had set in and a concerted effort was made to make good progress. There was still the usual hurdles, including a massive muddy puddle which needed to be negotiated.

We struggled through Tunworth and Winslade. The weather was still good. It was the not knowing how far was left that was a sapper. Daddy underestimated.... It was always 12 miles to go it seemed! Due to the slow progress it was decided at Preston Oak Hills that we should go the quickest route to the hotel. This meant predominantly road riding now for the remaining 7 miles which pleased us all. Mummy conceded and vowed to come back another time to follow the off road route. Quick progress was made until we got to the final 2 miles where there was a long uphill section and an off-road bit!

Cutting through the bush

Come on Mummy only 2 miles to go

We finally made 'The Woolpack Inn' at 7:30pm. Thank goodness it was a nice rural pub which done us an evening meal and some much needed drinks. We had lost a number of water bottles during the day. They must have fallen off the bike when lifting over the gates. The rooms were excellent. We had a double and a king size bed to share between the five of us. After our baths we settled down. Daddy and Katie watched New Zealand Grand Designs whilst the rest of us watch BGT.

Route

Well earned evening meal

We arranged a 3 day bike trip across Berkshire and Hampshire, called the Three Castles Walk, taking in Windsor, Odiham and Winchester. We've prepped by getting Ben a new-ish bike, Katie borrowing Lily's, Daddy mapping the route on the phone and Mummy has booked a couple of hotels.

We left at around 9:10 and cycled down to Frimley station. First whoops moment was Ben left his helmet at the station which Farmor later picked up. People were kind on the trains helping us on to and off the trains with the bikes. We first changed at Ascot, then Staines and finally rolled into Windsor Riverside just past 11am. The weather was changeable, but mostly dry.

Frimley Station

Chatting on the train to Windsor

The girls felt a bit claustrophobic by castle around Windsor. Lots of tourists as you can imagine. Bikes were not permitted on 'The Long Walk' so we detoured past Windsor football club and into Windsor Great Park. Jessica wasn't really getting into it. She would go very slowly and even walk when her enthusiasm was down..... and this behaviour started very early. Gordon Bennett, this was going to be a long three days!

Windsor Castle

We stopped off for an early lunch half way up a hill, under a tree whilst the rain poured. Thankfully it was a passing shower. Spirits were lifted as we went through the wide roads and some down hills! Life was good again. We stopped off and looked down 'The Long Walk' back towards the castle. We escaped one royal park, into another royal area; Prince Andrew's gaff at Sunninghill - this wasn't so impressive but we had a quick peek of the 'Great Pond'. Crossing the road, we hit the start of the old mile course at Ascot. Interesting to see the old concrete pillars which helped stop enemy aircraft using it as an airstrip during the war. Access to the middle of the race course is open to the public, so we ventured through, stopping off to watch some cricket on the way.

Early lunch stop in Windsor Great Park

The Long Walk

Jessa the speed demon

Pink cottage at edge of Windsor Great Park

We were still making slow progress but we were all up for the adventure. We stopped off at Englemere Pond for some refreshments before crossing Whitmore Bog, Swinley Park and then onto Swinley Forest. We won't mention the stop or non-stop at the Woodcutters pub! At Swinley Forest we stopped at the Look Out where Katie and Ben saw some friends who they played with whilst we had another ice cream stop! 25km achieved so far.

Next we trekked Swinley Forest showing Mummy where Ben had fallen down Gravel Hill a month before and the new mountain bike area that has been chained off because it's too dangerous. Katie whilst having a 'bathroom break' in the woods left her make up bag, so Daddy had to go back to go and collect.

We exited out of Bracknell Forest and into Broadmoor territory which of course got Katie's anxiety juices flowing. We were ordered to hurry on. And now we came across the first of the gates, styles, obstacles to stop bikes! Daddy's duty was to negotiate 5 bikes around each of these! At first quite fun, but the novelty quickly wore off! One set of obstacles was the railway line (36km) which we crossed near Ambarrow Court. Unfortunately Daddy dropped his phone and it cracked the screen! Arghhh.

By the time we got to Tri-Lakes we were ready to stop and wished our hotel would come to us, rather than vice versa. Mummy led us into someone's big property in Moulsham Green. The Indian man came out and was most helpful. Mummy was almost arguing with him, saying the book instructs us to go this way. The man helped us, and Mummy mis-read and agreed with the man in the end.... and felt a bit embarrassed about making a small fuss!

Finally we made it to the main road in Eversley and tried 2 pubs who had very similar menus and similar prices before settling on the third pub, The Golden Pot. We collapsed and sat down for a lovely big meal. Partly to celebrate Mummy's passing of her nursing exam.

Just up the road was our hotel, the Kingsley. It looked lovely and there were 5 beds for us. We showered, watched TV and slept well.... although Mummy complained a lot of her aching muscles and sore bottom!

Route

Daddy, Ben and Farfar went up to Wembley to watch Reading take on Huddersfield for a place in next years Premier League. The only previous Wembley visit for Ben was an England friendly. The atmosphere was totally different for this encounter.

We took up Phil Roe's Dad and nephew, Matthew. We drove to Hillingdon and stopped for a greasy spoon before catching the tube. The language was quite colourful on the train. An almost capacity crowd poured up Wembley Way. We sat separately from Phil and his family as tickets were hard to come by.

Wembley Way

The game itself was pretty dull. Reading played possession, non risky, slow build up, park the bus type football. Not very easy on the eye.

After 90 minutes and then a further 30 minutes of extra time it ended at 0-0. Penalties! Reading had it all in their hands 3-1 up.... and somehow they missed the remaining 2 pens and lost 4-3. Half the stadium emptied quickly.

Despite a poor result and game, it was an experience for Ben... and nice to share it with Farfar and the Roe family.

Farfar and Ben enjoying themselves

Wembley Stadium almost full

We dropped Jessica off at Emma's for basically the day. She had Grace's birthday party in the middle of the day. They went to Jakes at Trilakes where they played on the softplay and went around the petting farm. Emma looked after her for the rest of the day.

The rest of us went down to Pulborough with the Kayak and me up with: Ma ma, Pop Pop, Ellie, Rachel, Jon, Richard and a couple of Jon's friends. The brave few kayaked to Houghton bridge, 8 miles down stream. Ben travelled with Daddy, however he decided on the 'relaxed' approach. It was a really sunny day, a bit of a head wind, but really nothing much to complain about. The party met with Ma Ma and Mummy at Houghton Bridge where we stopped for some refreshments. Ben swapped out for Katie, after his dismount was far from easy. Ben managed to bang his knee and cut his hand in an aborted attempt to land on the other side of the bridge!

The final 4 miles went quickly and the scenery was a little more varied with nice overhanging trees. The Black Rabbit pub was the final destination where we all met up and had a nice pint of beer in the sunshine! Route

Watched by the cows

Katie doing the second stint

The dream team

The motley krew

Pop Pop and Auntie Ellie at Houghton Bridge

title.value: River Run Kayak, Jessica at Grace's 10th Birthday party

info.content:
In the morning Daddy was too injured for parkrun, and Mummy went off to complete her first solo smoking clinic effort which she enjoyed.

In the afternoon we all travelled to Ikea, Theale where we were on a mission to get some bedroom furniture for: Katie: Bed, pictures and desk. Jessica: Wardrobe, pictures. Mission accomplished, although we still do not know how we persuaded Daddy to allow Katie and double bed. We were Â£650 lighter!

In the evening Ma Ma and Pop Pop come to stay the night. We watched TV, whilst Daddy went over to Farmor's to clean her bike!

title.value: Smoking Clinic, Ikea, Ma Ma, Pop Pop Sleepover

info.content: Daddy went for a 4 miles run today which he completed at a leisurely pace. However, the after effects were not good. Wednesday and Thursday were spent hobbling around. A doctor's appointment has been booked for Tuesday!
Jessica starts Netball club at lunchtimes with the year 6's running it.

After church we went to Cranleigh for a Scarecrow hunt run by the village. We went into a small grocery shop to collect the sheet, then went around looking for scarecrows. The first was in a nice furniture shop, the rest were dotted around a council estate. So basically Mummy was enthusiastically walking around 50 yards ahead of everyone else who were not really enjoying the scarecrow experience. Still we all took the mickey out of Mummy and remained in high spirits. Another 3 hours of life we are not going to reclaim!

Later in the afternoon all four grandparents visited us which was very nice.

Cranleigh Scarecrow walk

In the morning Daddy went to parkrun and competed in his 202nd run. However, after 4km he was reduced to walking as his knee was in a lot of pain. After a few minutes it felt good again, so cruised in slowly.

Jessica left at lunchtime for Heidi's birthday party. They went shopping in Primark with Â£10 each and went to the cinema to watch A Dog's Purpose.

The rest of the family ventured to Alton and the Elder BBQ. It was nice to see the Glidewell's and Sanders' there too. We had a large BBQ, a game of PiÃ±ata, copious amounts of trampolining and a dash of 90's dance music.

Children's picnic

PiÃ±ata

Godmother and her god daughter

title.value: parkrun, Elder BBQ, Jessica at Heidi's 10th birthday party

info.content: Ben was put forward by head of year, Ms Rushby to go and see the headmaster for hot chocolate and chocolate biscuits at break time in the conference room! A handful of year 7 children were selected. All boffins Ben said. Mr Major (the head) asked one thing you liked about the school and one thing to improve. Ben answered that he enjoyed maths and that he would improve the queueing at lunchtime, where year 11 children push in. Well done Ben.

In the morning we had church as usual. Katie however went to Thorpe Park again this time with Alice and Catherine. She braved Colossus 3 times.

Meanwhile the rest of us went over to Reading to pick up a second hand bike for Ben - which is slightly better than the one he currently has. Straight from there we went to Eton for walk 91. It was a gloriously sunny day, nice to be meandering with the tourists north of the river on this 2 miles outing. Route

Hideaway as part of the college ground

Castle shot

title.value: Walk 91: Eton, Katie to Thorpe Park... again!

info.content:
In the morning Ben had his final match of the season, playing Camberley Rascals. Ben knew most of the opponents from school, even some in his class. To heighten the importance of the match, if Camberley drew or won the contest, they win the league. So it was Mytchett's job to spoil the party. 0-0 at half time and Camberley were in charge, but a stout Mytchett defence, which included Ben at right back kept the score equal. Tensions were running high on the side lines from the Camberley management. They had ringers from a better Camberley team and a full 4 subs. However, wonder-kid, Oliver had a rare foray into the opposition box and poked the ball home. 1-0 Mytchett with 20 minutes to go. Some strong tackles and heroic defending saw the game out stopping Camberley from winning the league. Tears were spilt on one side of the pitch, whilst on the other euphoric rejoice as the Mytchett players turned in their best, cohesive team performance of the season. Well done chaps.

We returned home for lunch with the Elders who popped over for a couple of hours to play.

The rest of the afternoon was spent doing gardening, painting, teaking the garden furniture.

title.value: Ben exciting football, Elder over for Lunch

info.content:
In the morning Katie departed for Thorpe Park with her friends. She has just bought a season pass allowing her access through out the year.

Meanwhile Lily and Jess played teachers and Barbie's all morning after having pancakes for breakfast.

Later in the afternoon we went down to Westgate (near Chichester) to surprise Jon for his 40th birthday. It was nice to see the Glidewells, Sanders and Elders. We had a kick about in the back garden with all the boys.

Jon blowing out 40 candles.... well almost

title.value: Jon's 40th Birthday surprise, Katie to Thorpe Park

info.content:
As Daddy was injured he was reduced to being a frustrated spectator. However, the rest of us ran the 2.5km course. Ben and Katie ran in at 13:10, whilst Mummy and Jessica got 15:08. Well done.

Pre Race

Sibling Race

Medal shot

Later in the afternoon we went off to Swinley Forrest and met with the Elders who joined us on Walk 90. In the book it reported to be 2 miles, in reality it was double that. Fortunately we had our bikes to stem the mutiny. Still I think the children had fun despite their protests. Route

Jessica balancing

The cousins

Beautiful mummy

Ladies of the lake

Climbing trees over the lake

Bikers

We all returned home for a BBQ, then Ben stayed over at the Elders for the night, whilst Lily stayed to play with us girls and watch While You Were Sleeping.

title.value: Frimley 2.5km Run, Walk 90: Swinley Forrest with Elders, BBQ, Lily-Ben swap

info.content:
Mytchett made it a record 3 wins in a row at Beacon Hill Sports with Ben playing in his un-favoured right back position. Oli weighed in again with all 4 goals in the 4-3 victory.

Half time team talk

At lunch we went to Farmor's who had a birthday (69) celebration lunch. All sorts of food from Baked Beans to Smoked Salmon, catering for all sorts of refined palettes! Us children were set a team, timed, initiative test by Farfar. Fortunately we passed and collected our prize. We ended the afternoon with a game of Coppit.

Make 5 triangles task

In the evening Mummy went out with Lindsey, Paula and Silvy to Prezzo's for a meal. We all snuggled up, toasted marshmallows over the fire and ate them with melted chocolate and watched Britain's Got Talent.

Jess and Ben snuggle up together

As a celebration for delivering 7.7.5 before Christmas, Daddy and his department went for a experience day at Thruxton race circuit. In the morning he went on the skid pan, then 4x4 followed by 3 laps driving a Porsche Cayman. The highlight was undoubtedly the lap as a passenger as a pro drove around. How the tyres stayed on the car and in one piece was amazing. It was fantastic.

In the morning Daddy went on a longish bike ride. His aim was to do 50km in two hours in the countryside to the west of Farnham. He managed it, but decided that was the last action on the legs. The knee is just getting worse rather than better. So now Daddy is injured for the next 3 weeks! Route

After church Ben was dropped off in Camberley for Yuvraj's 12th birthday party. First up ten pin bowling, which Ben came last in, then on to Frenchies for eat as much you like.

The rest of us went on walk 89, a short Windsor tour. Mummy parked in a cross hatched bay and got us a parking ticket! Anyway we had a nice walk around. It was quite a laugh, Daddy was trying to embarrass us all the way around! Route

King and his princesses

Shortest street in England apparently

'The Long Walk', but not on this occassion

Katie grabbed herself a soldier

title.value: Windsor Walk 89. Yuv's 12th Birthday Party. Injured!

info.content:
In the morning Ben had a football match against Cove. Mytchett kept a clean sheet for the first time this season and won 2-0.

Celebrating after

After lunch Mummy and Daddy travelled to Oxford Circus and wandered around Soho, stopped for a cup of tea in Yumchaa which was rather nice before continuing. Mummy gave Daddy 'Secret Cinema' tickets to watch Top Gun in the posh, Courthouse hotel. It included Champaigne as an aperitif. Neither could remember the details of the film from the previous time they watched the movie. It was good to re-watch. After, they went to have an Italian. They had a conversation with the waitress about Daddy's lazy eye which she noticed! Nice.

Yumchaa Tea

Courthouse hospitality

Meanwhile, Auntie Charlotte came over to look after us, later to be joined by the Elders. We had fun playing all afternoon.

title.value: Ben Football, Secret Cinema London, Char and Elders Babysit

info.content:
We met with the Sanders at Devil's Punchbowl, a National Trust site where there was an Easter Egg hunt, similar to what we have done in previous years. However, this was a little disappointing as the trail latest about 300 yards and it was all over in 10 minutes. Still we picnic'ed (now a verb) and caught up, which we haven't done for a long time.

Devil's Punchbowl Lineup

Tree Monkey

Totum Pole

title.value: Devils Punchbowl Easter Trail with Sanders

info.content:
We all got up for the 6am church service which was held on top of Frimley Green Rec hill! Even Daddy sacrificed a lie in to join the two roman centurions, a fire and a congregation of about 20 for the 40 minute service.

After we headed back home for Easter breakfast.

Easter Brekkie

Egg Lineup

The Weston's, Maisey's and Elders then came for Roast Pork lunch which went down very nicely, if a little manic.

After we went bowling with the rest of the Barnett family to celebrate Howard's 60th birthday. We had all six lanes booked out.

We then had an egg auction down at Frimley Lodge park and had a little play with the frisbee and football. Here we learnt that Ma Ma had a mini stroke during the week much to the dismay of Laura and Ellie who are forcing them to move closer to us.

Trying to get the children to line-up for a family under 14s photo was quite difficult, especially with some disruptive adults about!

Lodge Park fun

Kids lineup

After it was back to our house for some more Egg hunting in the back garden, a trampoline show from Katie and Jessica and a nice relaxing cup of tea in front of the fire!

Egg fun

title.value: 6am Church, Weston's For Lunch, Howard's 60th Bowling

info.content:
Daddy wanted a low key affair for his 200th parkrun. Not a major milestone in parkrun eyes (no t-shirt), but still it equates to 4 years of running. Daddy ran with both Mummy and Katie! Jessica and Ben were supporting from the side lines.

Daddy and Katie finishing

We then split, the girls went to the Stoddart household for an Egg hunt and a general chit chat. All the mum's were concerned about their teenage daughters in one way or another and Mummy thought about Katie and how we did not have any worries about her. She's a lovely, happy girl.... generally!

Daddy met with his parkrun friends at the Canal CafÃ© as usual and was given a 200 cake!

parkrun 200

In the afternoon we all went off to Chertsey where Ben was going to be mascot for the match against Camberley. The manager told people that Ben was the new winger! Ben had a one to one with Chertsey goalkeeper who took the time and trained with him for 20 minutes or so, giving him tips and making him feel really good.

Ben warming up the keeper

Ben shaking hands

Chertsey went on to lose the game 2-0 in a fairly dull contest. Thanks Farfar for arranging.

title.value: parkrun #200, Stoddart Egg Hunt, Ben Chertsey Mascot

info.content:
In the morning we had an Easter workshop at Church, which the Teales joined in with.

We then had the Fars, Susan and Graham over for a BBQ lunch and our first lot of Easter Egg giving.

The BBQ Krew

We ended the afternoon with a game of Trivial Pusuit which Jessica won!

Not so Trivial Pusuit

In the evening we all sat in front of the TV and watched Forrest Gump for the first time. It was rated quite highly for the young folk, if a little sad.

Old and new mascots

Alice came over to stay with us for a couple of days, whilst Katie went to share her time with Summer in Gravesend. Katie sounded like she had a great time. She went on the Pedlos at Bluewater, then today went to Southend to play on some of the fairground rides and walk along the sea front.

Southend

Katie and Summer

We children all agreed to go with farfar and farmor to The Black Country Museum, but thought it was indoors with things to see behind glass cases, and so maybe be a bit boring. It was not until we got near the place that we realised it was an outdoor museum, about the size of Frimley Green with real houses and shops showing what life was like over 100 years ago. There were also old fashioned buses and trams and activities, so it turned out to be great fun.

Old fashioned fairground

The museum is situated to the north west of Birmingham and this involved a lot of travelling including the longest train ride the two girls have ever done. Ben had previously been to York by train. First we caught a train from North Camp to Reading, then another to Birmingham. Next was a modern tram ride to the suburbs and to finish, a bus ride to the museum. It took almost four hours each way but we enjoyed travelling on the tram and the long distance express trains each way, that had a buffet on board.

Hanging around on street corners

The day was concluded just before eight in the evening by calling in to the Frimley Green Dominoâs Pizza shop on the way home for supper. It was a long but memorable day with fine weather all the time.

In the morning we went to church, except Daddy and Jessica who went off Kayaking early to Chertsey. They did the traditional Abbey River loop to Penton Hook lock, then back down the Thames to Chertsey bridge. It was the first time Jessica had attempted the loop. She did a bit of paddling at the front of the vessel. There were the usual obstacles of fallen trees, grounding on the shallows, a lock and even a pair of swans which they had to negotiate around. Route

Grounded Jessica

Kayaking pair

In the afternoon Ben and Daddy went of mountain biking. Ben wanted to attack the Lookout end of Swinley Forrest. They embarked on the 'blue' trails starting on number 1 and got as far as 8. Ben loved it, especially going around the high, fast burns. He was very brave as his bike is not built specifically for this terrain. No suspension! The pair were running out of water, so decided to head back. They got as far as going down the final Gravel Hill, then Ben hit a stone, lost balance and crashed. He lay on the ground with the bike a few feet further along the trail. He had scraped his arm and leg. Lucky he was wearing long trousers. Luckily the injuries were reduced to just cuts and scrapes. Hope this does not deter him! Route

Ben looking proud after a trail run

Ben and Daddy

Injuries

title.value: Church, Jessica Kayak River Abbey and Thames, Swinley Bike Crash

info.content:
In the morning Daddy ran with Mummy around parkrun. It was Mummy's first 5km attempt in a long while and they came in at about 32 minutes. We then picked Jessica up from a sleepover from around her friends house.

Mummy, Daddy and Natasha parkrunning

After lunch we went on Walk 88, much to the delight of the children! From the Berkshire walk book we had the Finchampstead loop around Horseshoe Lake. The weather was glorious, not a cloud in the sky. We sat for ice creams around the lake, played Pooh sticks and climbed trees over the River Blackwater. Route

Katie enjoying the views

Ice creams

Pooh sticks

At the age of 9.5 years, Jessica braved getting her ear pierced. She was very excited about the prospect and with the result. Very important to her.

Jessica Ears Pierced

It was a beautiful spring day. Deep blue skies and a decent temperature. Daddy was first out of the house, meeting up with Tim and his friend for an explore of the Tunnel Hill and Deepcut area on mountain bikes. Despite being on the doorstep, Daddy has not really explored too much these areas, especially for bike tracks. It was a long session, and the Santa Cruz bike was fantastic again. Route

After church, Ben was so tired he went to bed and slept for 6 hours plus. It was a shame as that put pay to a family walk. However, Jessica's friend, Grace knocked and asked if she wanted to go to Alice Holt taking the bike. So she did and spent most of the afternoon playing on the apparatus and cycling.

Meanwhile Daddy is trying to get the back garden in a respectable state. He's spent the evenings after work weeding, today he planted a couple of more flowers and mowed the lawn.

title.value: Tunnel Hill MTB, Church, Ben Sleep, Jess Alice Holt Bike, Gardening

info.content:
Busy day, all doing different stuff. First off Ben slept over at Ma Ma and Pop Pop's and had a McDonalds last night. It was part of Joey's birthday present. It's now traditional to have a 'shop till you drop' session. So Ben and Joey went to Lakeside this morning, Ben getting some new tracksuit bottoms.

Meanwhile Katie went with her 'acting' friend Catherine and her mum to help at Heatherside Community Centre to do some craft for kids in aid of Marie Curie. She was very willing. In the end she done well financially out of it, despite her protestations.

Mummy had another observation session with Quit51, where she had to see patients who are trying to quit smoking. Soon she'll be able to run these sessions herself. We still await her essay results.

Meanwhile Daddy went to parkrun, met with Farmor and later Jessica. A trip down to the Canal cafÃ© was required to replenish stocks. Jessica had chips! Route

Jessica playing with Farmor at FLP

In the afternoon we all came together again at the house. We had a visit from Ma Ma, Pop Pop and Joey. The main event was still to come. Mayhem for the next 18 hours. A Benny Sleepover party! It started at 4pm with Oli, Yuv, Kieron, Freddie and Callum all around for the night. After a spot of PS4, we all went over to the Rec to play football. Mummy ran for 25 minutes as part of her 'couch to 5km' plan. They played World Cup then a game of 3 v 3.

Pizza for tea and a combination of playing in the back garden (football and trampoline) and Rocket League on the PS4 wailed the hours away long into the night. Freddie went home early, Callum slept, but the rest stayed up all night. No sleep!

Football down the rec

title.value: Ben Shopping, parkrun, Mummy Quit51, Katie Marie Curie help, Ben Wake-over

info.content:
Ben and 7 of his mates completed a 5km course having tied their ankles together. It was a 3 legged race on steroids! It was a charity event at school.

Ben and his 7 friends tied together

Ben is going through an interesting phase with his friends at the moment. The other week, they went down the rec to play football, only for another group of boys that they know came along and started stealing the ball from them and then it descended into verbal and physical bullying. The other group of boys got reprimanded from the school. So having been on the receiving end you'd thought they would be sensitive to some bullying behaviour. However, a new friend was tagging along with Ben's gang. However, the rest of Ben's gang were not nice to him, calling him things and tripping him up and stuff. Not really bad, but enough to make this boy cry. Ben stood up for this boy telling his 5 or 6 mates that it was not fair and basically saying it was unacceptable behaviour. The rest of the gang then started taking the mick out of Ben and dismissing / laughing off his protests. This made Ben cry. Ben apologised to the boy on behalf of the gang, even though he was not involved in the bullying. Ben tried to make up with the rest of the group, but they still dismissed him. Again Ben cried as they didn't seem to care for his feelings.

Both Mummy and Daddy were exceptionally proud of Ben's attitude and handling of the situation. He was sensitive to what was right and wrong and prepared to be mocked by his closest buddies for this. He questioned his friendship to them also. If they were not going to change their views he didn't see a future with them. Such a mature, strong, stance on shoulders so young.

The morning after he received apologies from the rest of the gang and he made up with them. He was seriously going to cancel this weekend's sleepover he had planned. He skipped football training tonight and went for a bike ride with Daddy instead.

title.value: Ben standing up for a friend

info.content:
Mother's Day and we awoke in the Weston household and gave Ma Ma a nice breakfast before we had to rush home for church.

Then Mummy was pampered and treated. Katie made lunch and gave mummy a bath, whilst Ben went out for a lunchtime jog. Later in the afternoon we all watched 'Dirty Rotten Scoundrels' which we found entertaining.

Daddy was flogging his guts out in Cwmbran, mountain biking. He did two trails: Twrch and Cafall. They were tough.

Route

From Katie

From Jessica

From Ben

A full weekend ahead. Daddy had stayed at the Elders last night as he had an early start to make Merthyr Tydfil for 9am. Charlotte had stayed over last night. The Elders came over before we all headed to Gravesend. Pop Pop took us 6 children to Cascades swimming which was good fun.

Meanwhile as a Mother's Day present to Ma Ma, her three daughters 'treated' her to a Escape Room experience. Basically you have to solve a series of clues to escape the room within an hour. It was themed as a panic room. We think Ma Ma strangely enjoyed it.

Panic Room, Gravesend

Later in the afternoon there was a split; Katie, Ellie, Lily, Ma Ma went off to Bluewater for some retail therapy, Mummy, Toby, Pop Pop and Jessica watched Toy Story, the boys were of course on the computer.

Daddy arrived at Bike Park Wales, a downhill mountain biking facility joining up with Michael's Alton friends and Nick. He felt a bit out of depth as everyone had their multi thousand pound bikes, armour, all sorts of kit. Daddy on the other hand had a borrowed bike, no armour, no kit. Still eventually they all made it to the top of the hill courtesy of the 'uplift' service, a 15 minute minibus ride. And down they go, first tackling a number of 'blue' runs, before extending themselves on the 'red' trails. Daddy was amazed how much punishment the bike could take in terms of the speed over the terrain. Like a 4x4 truck. There were some seemingly quick bits, although looking on the video it seemed reasonably steady.

Back wheel jumped up strangely

Daddy fell off properly just the once. A scratch on the leg and fortunately no damage to the bike which was borrowed off an old work colleague, Tim.

Some of the Bike Park Wales possy

title.value: Swimming with Pop Pop, Shopping, Bike Park Wales, Panic Room

info.content:
As a Christmas Present Mummy got Daddy a couple of Rob Brydon tickets. Performing in the Anvil theatre, Basingstoke, they first had a warm up comedian who was very good. Then they were treated to Rob Brydon who got his observations about middle-age out of the way quickly, and spent the rest of his time toying with the crowd. By the end, he was improvising songs about their lives. He took the micky out of Tadley, and said Basingstoker's aspired to be in Winchester! He sang, took requests, gave impressions,and told anecdotes. Thoroughly entertaining.

Mummy and Daddy before going out

Rob Brydon on stage

So the big day. Daddy has been eating well for the past 2 weeks, training harder for the past 4 or 5 weeks. No cakes, no beer, not even Cornflakes of an evening. Early night, warm-up run early, extra glucose levels vigilance, no big runs during the week, breakfast 3 hours before. All text book preparation. Daddy deffo aiming for 2 hours. The secondary target was to beat Richard who was also aiming for sub 2 hours. Charlotte was also running. Conversely she hadn't trained, drank beer the night before, had a late night and not much breakfast. Other runners included: Ellie, Richard, Rachel and the rest of the Frimley Flyers crew, so a big turn out.

Daddy early tactic of keeping Richard in his sites soon disappeared within the first kilometre. Richard was away and gone and smashed his PB in a time of 1:52. Ellie and Charlotte ran together for the first 10 miles and did amazingly well coming in at 2:08 and 2:18 respectively. Absolutely fantastic considering they both have never run the distance before. Rachel also came in at 2:08.

Daddy was feeling rough at 9km, getting pins and needles in his legs and was ready to give up. However,a disgusting gel later, that feeling had dissipated and he got back on track at 11km. Daddy ran every kilometre under 6min and his fastest km was the 21st and last. Route

Daddy, Ellie and Chardo

Frimley Flyers

Fleet High Five in the High Street

A good mornings work had by all. We all went off to the Sanders household for Sausages and pizza.

Mummy and Daddy went to parkrun. Ben then played football at Heatherside and lost 7-0.

Ben's football

In the afternoon there was a girls shopping trip to M and S for Katie's clothes, then a subsequent trip into Camberley to get Jessica some stationary things!

The Maisey's came over for dinner and a sleepover. We had a 3 hour game of Monopoly which Charlotte won.

Marathon Monopoly game

title.value: parkrun, Football, Girls shopping trips, Maisey's over

info.content:
